44001016	“ Brethren , the Scripture had to be fulfilled , which the Ruach ha-Kodesh foretold by the mouth of David , concerning Judah — who became a guide to those who seized Yeshua .
44001017	For he was counted among us and received his share of this office . ”
44001018	( Now this man Judah bought a field with the reward of his wickedness . Falling headfirst , he burst open in the middle and his intestines splattered out .
44001019	And it became known to all those living in Jerusalem , so in their own language that field was called Akeldama — that is , ‘ Field of Blood . ’ )
44001020	For it is written in the Book of Psalms , ‘ Let his dwelling place become desolate , and let there be no one living in it ’ and ‘ Let another take his position . ’
44001021	“ Therefore one of the men who have accompanied us all the time that the Lord Yeshua went in and out among us —
44001022	beginning with His immersion by John until the day He was taken up from us — must become a witness with us of His resurrection . ”
44001023	So they nominated two — Joseph , called Barsabbas ( also called Justus ) , and Matthias .
44001024	And they prayed and said , “ You , O Lord , who knows the hearts of all men , show us which of these two You have chosen
44001025	to take the position in this office as shaliach , from which Judah turned aside to go to his own place . ”
44001026	Then they cast lots for them , and the lot fell upon Matthias ; and he was added to the eleven shlichim .
44002001	When the day of Shavuot had come , they were all together in one place .
44002002	Suddenly there came from heaven a sound like a mighty rushing wind , and it filled the whole house where they were sitting .
44002003	And tongues like fire spreading out appeared to them and settled on each one of them .
44002004	They were all filled with the Ruach ha-Kodesh and began to speak in other tongues as the Ruach enabled them to speak out .
44002005	Now Jewish people were staying in Jerusalem , devout men from every nation under heaven .
44002006	And when this sound came , the crowd gathered . They were bewildered , because each was hearing them speaking in his own language .
44002007	And they were amazed and astonished , saying , “ All these who are speaking — aren’t they Galileans ?
44002008	How is it that we each hear our own birth language ?
44002009	Parthians and Medes and Elamites and those living in Mesopotamia , Judea and Cappadocia , Pontus and Asia ,
44002010	Phrygia and Pamphylia , Egypt and parts of Libya toward Cyrene , and visitors from Rome
44002011	( both Jewish people and proselytes ) , Cretans and Arabs — we hear them declaring in our own tongues the mighty deeds of God ! ”
44002012	And they were all amazed and perplexed , saying to each other , “ What does this mean ? ”
44002013	Others , poking fun , were saying , “ They are full of sweet new wine ! ”
44002014	But Peter , standing with the Eleven , raised his voice and addressed them : “ Fellow Judeans and all who are staying in Jerusalem , let this be known to you , and pay attention to my words .
44002015	These men are not drunk , as you suppose — for it’s only the third hour of the day !
44002016	But this is what was spoken about through the prophet Joel :
44002017	‘ And it shall be in the last days , ’ says God , ‘ that I will pour out My Ruach on all flesh . Your sons and your daughters shall prophesy , your young men shall see visions , and your old men shall dream dreams .
44002018	Even on My slaves , male and female , I will pour out My Ruach in those days , and they shall prophesy .
44002019	And I will give wonders in the sky above and signs on the earth beneath — blood , and fire , and smoky vapor .
44002020	The sun shall be turned to darkness and the moon to blood before the great and glorious Day of Adonai comes .
44002021	And it shall be that everyone who calls on the name of Adonai shall be saved . ’
44002022	“ Men of Israel , hear these words ! Yeshua ha-Natzrati — a Man authenticated to you by God with mighty deeds and wonders and signs God performed through Him in your midst , as you yourselves know —

44002047	praising God and having favor with all the people . And every day the Lord was adding to their number those being saved .
44003001	Now Peter and John were going up to the Temple at the ninth hour , the time of prayer .
44003002	A man lame from birth was being carried — every day they used to put him at the Temple gate called Beautiful , so he could beg for tzedakah from those entering the Temple .
44003003	When he saw Peter and John about to go into the Temple , he began asking to receive tzedakah .
44003004	But Peter , along with John , looked straight at him and said , “ Look at us ! ”
44003005	So he gave them his attention , expecting to receive something from them .
44003006	But Peter said , “ Silver and gold I do not have , but what I do have I give to you — in the name of Yeshua ha-Mashiach ha-Natzrati , get up and walk ! ”
44003007	Then grabbing him by the right hand , he raised him up ; and immediately the man’s feet and ankles were made strong .

44003009	Now all the people saw him walking and praising God .

44003011	While he was clinging to Peter and John , all the people together came running toward them in the place called Solomon's Portico .

44004001	As Peter and John were speaking to the people , the kohanim and the captain of the Temple and the Sadducees came up to them .
44004002	They were indignant because Peter and John were teaching the people and announcing in Yeshua the resurrection of the dead .
44004003	So they grabbed them and put them in jail until the next day , for it was already evening .
44004004	But many who heard the message believed , and the number of the men came to about five thousand .
44004005	On the next day , the rulers and elders and Torah scholars were gathered together in Jerusalem .
44004006	Annas the kohen gadol was there , and Caiaphas and John and Alexander , and all those who were of high-priestly descent .

44004008	Then Peter , filled with the Ruach ha-Kodesh , said to them , “ Rulers and elders of the people !

44004014	But seeing the healed man standing with them , they had nothing to say in response .
44004015	When they had ordered Peter and John to go out of the council chamber , they began to confer with one another ,
44004016	saying , “ What shall we do with these men ? For indeed , it’s obvious to everyone living in Jerusalem that a remarkable miracle has happened through them , and we cannot deny it .
44004017	But so it won’t spread any further among the people , let’s warn them not to speak anymore to anyone in this name . ”
44004018	So they called them in and ordered them not to speak or teach at all in the name of Yeshua .

44004020	For we cannot stop speaking about what we have seen and heard . ”
44004021	After threatening them again , they let them go — finding no way they could punish them on account of the people , because they all were glorifying God for what had happened .
44004022	For the man in whom this miracle of healing had happened was more than forty years old .
44004023	As soon as they were released , Peter and John went to their own people and reported all that the ruling kohanim and elders had said to them .

44004037	He sold a field that he owned and brought the money and laid it at the feet of the shlichim .
44005001	On the other hand , a man named Ananias together with his wife , Sapphira , sold a property .
44005002	He kept back some of the proceeds , with his wife’s full knowledge , and brought part of it and set it at the feet of the shlichim .

44005006	The young men got up and wrapped him in a shroud , then carried him out and buried him .

44005008	Peter responded to her , “ Tell me if you sold the land for this much . ” She said , “ Yes , for that much . ”

44005010	Immediately she fell down at his feet and died . When the young men came back in , they found her dead and carried her out and buried her beside her husband .

44005022	But when the officers came , they did not find them in the prison . So they returned and reported ,

44007001	Then the kohen gadol said , “ Are these things so ? ”
44007002	Stephen declared , “ Brethren and fathers , listen . The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia , before he lived in Haran .
44007003	He said to him , ‘ Leave your country and your relatives , and come here to the land that I will show you . ’
44007004	Then he left the land of the Chaldeans and settled in Haran . From there , after his father died , God moved him to this land where you now live .
44007005	He gave him no inheritance in it — not even a foothold — yet He promised ‘ to give it to him as a possession to him and to his descendants after him , ’ even though he had no child .
44007006	“ But God spoke in this way , that his ‘ descendants would be foreigners in a land belonging to others , and they would enslave and mistreat them for four hundred years .
44007007	But I will judge the nation they serve as slaves , ’ God said , ‘ and afterward they shall come out and serve Me in this place . ’
44007008	“ Then God gave Abraham the covenant of circumcision . So he became the father of Isaac and circumcised him on the eighth day , and so Isaac with Jacob , and Jacob with the twelve patriarchs .

44007011	“ Famine and great suffering came over all Egypt and Canaan , and our fathers could find no food .
44007012	But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt , he sent our fathers there the first time .
44007013	On the second visit , Joseph made himself known to his brothers , and his family became known to Pharaoh .
44007014	So Joseph sent and called for Jacob and all his relatives — seventy-five persons .
44007015	Jacob went down to Egypt and died , he and our fathers .
44007016	They were carried to Shechem and laid in the tomb that Abraham had bought for a sum of money from the sons of Hamor in Shechem .
44007017	“ But as the time drew near for the promise God had sworn to Abraham , the people increased and multiplied in Egypt —
44007018	until ‘ there arose another king over Egypt who knew nothing about Joseph . ’
44007019	Dealing with our people with cruel cunning , this king mistreated our fathers and forced them to abandon their infants so they would not survive .
44007020	“ At this time Moses was born — extraordinary before God . For three months he was nurtured in his father's house .
44007021	And when he was set outside , Pharaoh's daughter took him and raised him as her own son .
44007022	Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians , and he was powerful in his words and deeds .
44007023	“ When he was approaching forty years of age , it came into his heart to visit his brethren , B’nei-Israel .
44007024	When he saw one of them being treated unjustly , he went to the defense of the oppressed man and avenged him by striking down the Egyptian .
44007025	He was assuming that his brethren understood that by his hand God was delivering them , but they did not understand .
44007026	So on the next day he appeared to them as they were fighting . He tried to reconcile them in shalom , saying , ‘ Men , you are brothers . Why do you wrong one another ? ’
44007027	“ But the one doing wrong to his neighbor pushed him away , saying , ‘ Who appointed you ruler and judge over us ?
44007028	You don’t want to kill me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday , do you ? ’

44007032	‘ I am the God of your fathers , the God of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob . ’ “ Moses trembled in fear and did not dare to look .
44007033	But Adonai said to him , ‘ Take the sandals off your feet , for the place where you are standing is holy ground .
44007034	I have surely seen the oppression of my people in Egypt and have heard their groaning , and I have come down to deliver them . Now come — let Me send you to Egypt . ’

44008001	Now Saul was in agreement with Stephen’s execution . On that day a great persecution arose against Messiah’s community in Jerusalem , and they were all scattered throughout the region of Judea and Samaria , except the shlichim .
44008002	Some devout men buried Stephen and mourned deeply for him .

44008004	Now those who had been scattered went around proclaiming the Word .
44008005	Philip went down to the main city of Samaria and proclaimed the Messiah to them .
44008006	The crowds were paying close attention to what Philip was saying — as they both heard and saw the signs that he was doing .
44008007	For unclean spirits were coming out of many who were plagued , shrieking with a loud voice . Many paralyzed and crippled were healed also .
44008008	So there was great joy in that city .
44008009	Now a man named Simon had been practicing magic in the city and astonishing the people of Samaria , saying he was someone great .

44008020	Peter said to him , “ May your silver go to ruin , and you with it — because you thought you could buy God’s gift with money !

44008026	Now an angel of the Lord spoke to Philip , saying , “ Get up , and go south on the road going down from Jerusalem to Gaza . ” ( This is a desert road . )
44008027	So he got up and went . And behold , an Ethiopian eunuch — an official who was responsible for all the treasure of Candace , queen of the Ethiopians — had traveled to Jerusalem to worship
44008028	and was now returning . Sitting in his chariot , he was reading the prophet Isaiah .

44008031	“ How can I , ” he said , “ unless someone guides me ? ” So he invited Philip to come up and sit with him .
44008032	Now the passage of Scripture that he was reading was this : “ He was led as a sheep to slaughter ; and as a lamb before its shearer is silent , so He opens not His Mouth .
44008033	In His humiliation justice was denied Him . Who shall recount His generation ? For His life is taken away from the earth . ”
44008034	The eunuch replied to Philip , “ Please tell me , who is the prophet talking about — himself or someone else ? ”
44008035	Then Philip opened his mouth , and beginning with this Scripture he proclaimed the Good News about Yeshua .
44008036	Now as they were going down the road , they came to some water . The eunuch said , “ Look , water ! What’s to prevent me from being immersed ? ”
44008038	He ordered the chariot to stop . They both got down into the water , Philip and the eunuch , and Philip immersed him .
44008039	When they came up out of the water , the Ruach Adonai snatched Philip away . The eunuch saw no more of him , for he went on his way , rejoicing .
44008040	But Philip found himself at Azotus . And as he passed through , he kept proclaiming the Good News to all the towns until he came to Caesarea .
44009001	Now Saul , still breathing out threats and murder against the Lord’s disciples , went to the kohen gadol .
44009002	He requested letters of introduction from him to the synagogues in Damascus , so that if he found any men or women belonging to the Way , he might bring them as prisoners to Jerusalem .
44009003	As he was traveling , approaching Damascus , suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him .
44009004	Falling to the ground , he heard a voice saying to him , “ Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting Me ? ”
44009005	“ Who are You , Lord ? ” Saul said . “ I am Yeshua — whom you are persecuting .
44009006	But get up and go into the city , and you will be told what you must do . ”
44009007	The men travelling with him stood speechless , hearing the voice but seeing no one .
44009008	Saul got up from the ground — but opening his eyes , he could see nothing . They led him by the hand and brought him into Damascus .
44009009	For three days he could not see , and he did not eat or drink .
44009010	Now there was a disciple named Ananias in Damascus . The Lord said to him , “ Ananias . ” He said , “ Here I am , Lord . ”
44009011	The Lord said to him , “ Get up and go to the street named Straight , and ask in the house of Judah for someone from Tarsus named Saul . For look , he is praying ;
44009012	and in a vision he has seen a man named Ananias coming in and laying his hands on him , so that he might regain his sight . ”
44009013	But Ananias answered , “ Lord , I have heard from many about this man — how much harm he has done to your kedoshim in Jerusalem .
44009014	And here he has authority from the ruling kohanim to tie up all who call on Your name . ”
44009015	But the Lord said to him , “ Go , for he is a choice instrument to carry My name before nations and kings and B’nei-Israel .
44009016	For I will show him how much he must suffer for My name’s sake . ”
44009017	So Ananias left and entered into the house . Laying hands on Saul , he said , “ Brother Saul , the Lord — Yeshua , the One who appeared to you on the road by which you were coming — has sent me , so that you might regain your sight and be filled with the Ruach ha-Kodesh . ”
44009018	Immediately , something like scales fell from Saul’s eyes , and he regained his sight . Then he got up and was immersed ;
44009019	and when he had taken food , he was strengthened . Now for several days , he was with the disciples in Damascus .
44009020	Immediately he began proclaiming Yeshua in the synagogues , saying , “ He is Ben-Elohim . ”
44009021	All those hearing him were amazed . They were saying , “ Isn’t this the one who made havoc in Jerusalem for all those who call on this name ? And hasn’t he come here to bring them as prisoners before the ruling kohanim ? ”
44009022	But Saul kept growing stronger , and he was confounding the Jewish people living in Damascus by proving that Yeshua is the Messiah .
44009023	When many days had passed , these Jewish people plotted to kill him —
44009024	but their plot became known to Saul . They were watching the gates day and night , to kill him .
44009025	But the disciples took Saul by night and let him down over the wall , lowering him in a basket .
44009026	When Saul arrived in Jerusalem , he made attempts to join up with the disciples — but they were all afraid of him , not believing that he was a disciple .
44009027	But Barnabas took him in and brought him to the shlichim . He described to them how Saul had seen the Lord on the road and the Lord had spoken to him , and how he had spoken boldly in the name of Yeshua .
44009028	So Saul was with them , going in and out in Jerusalem , speaking boldly in the name of the Lord .
44009029	He was speaking and arguing with the Hellenists , but they were trying to kill him .
44009030	When the brethren found out , they brought him down to Caesarea and sent him off to Tarsus .
44009031	So Messiah’s community throughout all Judea and Galilee and Samaria had shalom and was built up . Walking in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Ruach ha-Kodesh , it kept multiplying .
44009032	Peter went here and there among them all . He came down as well to the kedoshim living in Lydda .
44009033	There he found a man named Aeneas , who had been bedridden for eight years — he was paralyzed .
44009034	Peter said to him , “ Aeneas , Messiah Yeshua heals you . Get up and pack up your bed . ” Immediately , he got up !
44009035	All who lived in Lydda and the Plain of Sharon saw him , and they turned to the Lord .
44009036	In Joppa , there was a disciple named Tabitha ( which translates as Dorcas ) . She was full of mitzvot and tzedakah , which she continually did .
44009037	In those days , she became ill and died . When they had washed her for burial , they placed her in an upstairs room .
44009038	Since Lydda was near Joppa , the disciples — hearing that Peter was there — sent two men to him , begging him , “ Please come to us without delay ! ”
44009039	So Peter got up and went with them . When he arrived , they took him to the upstairs room . All the widows were crying , showing all the tunics and other clothing Dorcas had made while she was with them .
44009040	But Peter sent them all outside , and he got down on his knees and prayed . Then , turning to the body , he said “ Tabitha , get up ! ” She opened her eyes , and when she saw Peter , she sat up .
44009041	He gave her his hand and raised her up . Then he called the kedoshim and widows and presented her alive .
44009042	It became known throughout Joppa , and many came to believe in the Lord .
44009043	So it happened that Peter stayed on in Joppa for several days with Simon , a tanner .
44010001	Now in Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius , a centurion of what was called the Italian Cohort .
44010002	He was a devout man , revering God with all his household . He gave tzedakah generously to the people and prayed to God continually .
44010003	About the ninth hour of the day , he saw clearly in a vision an angel of God coming and saying to him , “ Cornelius ! ”
44010004	He stared at him in terror and said , “ What is it , Lord ? ” The angel said to him , “ Your prayers and tzedakah have gone up as a memorial offering before God .
44010005	Now send men to Joppa and call for Simon , also named Peter .
44010006	He is being entertained as a guest by Simon the tanner , whose house is beside the sea . ”
44010007	When the angel speaking to him had left , he called two of his servants and a soldier from among those attached to his command .
44010008	After he explained everything to them , he sent them to Joppa .
44010009	The next day , as the soldiers were traveling and approaching the city , Peter went up to the rooftop to pray , at about the sixth hour .
44010010	Now he became very hungry and wanted to eat ; but while they were preparing something , he fell into a trance .
44010011	He saw the heavens opened , and something like a great sheet coming down , lowered by its four corners to the earth .
44010012	In it were all sorts of four-footed animals and reptiles and birds of the air .
44010013	A voice came to him , “ Get up , Peter . Kill and eat . ”
44010014	But Peter said , “ Certainly not , Lord ! For never have I eaten anything unholy or unclean . ”
44010015	Again a voice came to him , a second time : “ What God has made clean , you must not consider unholy . ”
44010016	This happened three times , and the sheet was immediately taken up to heaven .
44010017	Now while Peter was puzzling about what the vision he had seen might mean , behold , the men sent by Cornelius found Simon’s house and appeared before the gate .
44010018	They called out and began to ask whether Simon , also called Peter , was staying in this place as a guest .
44010019	Now while Peter was mulling over the vision , the Ruach said to him , “ Look here , three men are looking for you .
44010020	But get up , go downstairs , and go with them without hesitating , because I Myself have sent them . ”
44010021	Going down to the men , Peter said , “ Here , I’m the one you’re looking for . What is the reason for your coming ? ”
44010022	And they said , “ Cornelius , a centurion , a righteous and God-fearing man well-spoken of by all the Jewish people , was directed by a holy angel to summon you to his house and to hear a message from you . ”
44010023	So Peter invited them in to be his guests . The next day he got up and went with them , and some of the brethren from Joppa accompanied him .
44010024	The following day he entered Caesarea . Cornelius was waiting for them and had called together his relatives and close friends .
44010025	As Peter entered , Cornelius met him and fell down at his feet and worshiped him .
44010026	But Peter pulled him up , saying , “ Stand up ! I too am just a man . ”
44010027	Talking with him , Peter went inside and found many people gathered .
44010028	He said to them , “ You yourselves know that it is not permitted for a Jewish man to associate with a non-Jew or to visit him . Yet God has shown me that I should call no one unholy or unclean .
44010029	So I came without objection when I was sent for . I ask , then , what is the reason why you sent for me ? ”
44010030	Cornelius declared , “ Four days ago at this hour , I was praying minchah in my house . Suddenly , a man stood in front of me in shining clothes .
44010031	He says , ‘ Cornelius , your prayer has been heard and your tzedakah remembered before God .
44010032	Therefore send to Joppa and ask for Simon , who is also called Peter . He is staying in the house of Simon the tanner , by the sea . ’
44010033	So I sent for you immediately , and you have been kind enough to come . Now then , we are all here before God to hear all that you have been commanded by the Lord . ”
44010034	Then Peter opened his mouth and said , “ I truly understand that God is not one to show favoritism ,
44010035	but in every nation the one who fears Him and does what is right is acceptable to Him .
44010036	You know the message He sent to B’nei-Israel , proclaiming shalom through Messiah Yeshua — He is Lord of all .
44010037	You know the message that has spread throughout all Judea , beginning from Galilee after the immersion that John proclaimed .
44010038	You know how God anointed Y eshua of Natzeret with the Ruach ha-Kodesh and power — how He went about doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil , because God was with Him .
44010039	We are witnesses to all He did , both in the Judean countryside and in Jerusalem . They put Him to death by hanging Him on a tree ,
44010040	but God raised Him up on the third day and caused Him to be visible —
44010041	not to all the people , but to us , witnesses who were chosen beforehand by God . We ate and drank with Him after He rose from the dead .
44010042	And He commanded us to proclaim to the people and to testify that He is the One ordained by God as Judge of the living and the dead .
44010043	All the prophets testify about Him — that everyone who puts his trust in Him receives forgiveness of sins through His name . ”
44010044	While Peter was still speaking these words , the Ruach ha-Kodesh fell on all those hearing the message .
44010045	All the circumcised believers who came with Peter were astonished , because the gift of the Ruach ha-Kodesh had been poured out even on the Gentiles .
44010046	For they were hearing them speaking in tongues and magnifying God . Then Peter answered ,
44010047	“ Can anyone refuse water for these to be immersed , who have received the Ruach ha-Kodesh just as we did ? ”
44010048	So he commanded them to be immersed in the name of Messiah Yeshua . Then they asked him to stay for a few days .
44011001	Now the shlichim and brethren throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God .
44011002	But when Peter went up to Jerusalem , those of the circumcision took issue with him ,
44011003	saying , “ You went to uncircumcised men and ate with them ! ”
44011004	So Peter began explaining to them point by point , saying ,
44011005	“ I was in the city of Joppa praying , and in a trance I saw a vision — something like a great sheet coming down , being lowered from heaven by its four corners , and it came right to me .
44011006	I looked inside , considering it carefully , and saw four-footed creatures of the earth , wild animals , reptiles , and birds of the air .
44011007	I also heard a voice saying , ‘ Get up , Peter . Kill and eat . ’
44011008	“ But I said , ‘ Certainly not , Lord ! For never has anything unholy or unclean entered my mouth . ’
44011009	But a voice from heaven answered a second time , ‘ What God has made clean , you must not consider unholy . ’
44011010	This happened three times , and then everything was pulled up to heaven .
44011011	“ At that very moment , three men arrived at the house where we were , sent to me from Caesarea .
44011012	The Ruach told me to go with them without hesitating . These six brethren also went with me , and we entered the man's house .
44011013	He reported to us how he had seen an angel standing in his house and saying , ‘ Send to Joppa and bring Simon called Peter .
44011014	He will speak words to you by which you will be saved — you and all your household . ’
44011015	“ As I began to speak , the Ruach ha-Kodesh fell on them , just as on us at the beginning .
44011016	And I remembered the word of the Lord , how He used to say , ‘ John immersed with water , but you will be immersed in the Ruach ha-Kodesh . ’
44011017	Therefore if God gave them the same gift as also to us after we put our trust in the Lord Messiah Yeshua , who was I to stand in God’s way ? ”
44011018	When they heard this they became quiet , and they glorified God , saying , “ Then even to the Gentiles God has granted repentance leading to life ! ” Discipling in Diaspora
44011019	Now those scattered because of the persecution that happened in connection with Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch , telling the message only to Judeans .
44011020	However , there were some of them , men of Cyprus and Cyrene , who came to Antioch and began speaking to the Hellenists also , proclaiming the Lord Yeshua .
44011021	The hand of the Lord was with them , and a great number who believed turned to the Lord .
44011022	News about these things reached the ears of the community in Jerusalem , and they sent Barnabas to Antioch .
44011023	When he arrived and saw the grace of God , he was thrilled . He encouraged them all to remain true to the Lord with heartfelt devotion .
44011024	For Barnabas was a good man , full of the Ruach ha-Kodesh and faith . And a large number was added to the Lord .
44011025	Then Barnabas left for Tarsus to look for Saul ,
44011026	and when he had found him , he brought him to Antioch . For a whole year they met together with Messiah’s community and taught a large number . Now it was in Antioch that the disciples were first called “ Christianoi . ”
44011027	Now in these days prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch .
44011028	One of them , named Agabus , stood up and predicted through the Ruach that there was going to be a great famine over all the world . ( This took place during the reign of Claudius . )
44011029	So the disciples decided to send relief to those brethren living in Judea , each according to his ability .
44011030	This they did , sending it to the elders by the hand of Barnabas and Saul .
44012001	Now at that time Herod the king seized some from Messiah’s community to do them harm .
44012002	He had Jacob , John's brother , put to death with the sword .
44012003	Seeing it pleased the Judean leaders , he proceeded to capture Peter as well . This was during the Days of Matzah .
44012004	After seizing him , he put him in prison , handing him over to four squads with four soldiers each to guard him . He was intending to bring him before the people after Passover .
44012005	So Peter was kept in prison , but prayer for him was being offered fervently to God by Messiah’s community .
44012006	Now that very night when Herod was about to bring him out , Peter was sleeping — bound with two chains between two soldiers , while guards before the gate were keeping watch over the prison .
44012007	Suddenly an angel of the Lord appeared , and a light shone in the cell . He poked Peter on the side and woke him up , saying , “ Get up ! Quick ! ” And the chains fell off his hands .
44012008	Then the angel said to him , “ Get dressed and put on your sandals , ” and he did so . Then he tells him , “ Put on your cloak and follow me . ”
44012009	Peter went out and kept following him — he didn’t know that what was happening with the angel was real , but thought he was seeing a vision .
44012010	After they passed a first guard and a second , they came to the iron gate leading into the city . It opened for them by itself . They went out and walked along a narrow street . Suddenly the angel left him .
44012011	When Peter came to himself , he said , “ Now I know for real that the Lord has sent His angel and delivered me from the hand of Herod and from all that the Judean people were expecting . ”
44012012	When he realized this , he went to the house of Miriam , the mother of John ( also called Mark ) , where many were assembled together and praying .
44012013	When he knocked on the door of the entrance gate , a maid named Rhoda came to answer .
44012014	Although she recognized Peter's voice , out of joy she did not open the gate but ran in and announced that Peter was standing in front of the gate .
44012015	They said to her , “ You're crazy ! ” But she kept insisting it was so . But they were saying , “ It is his angel . ”
44012016	But Peter kept on knocking . When they opened the gate , they saw him and were amazed !
44012017	But he motioned with his hand for them to be silent , and he explained to them how the Lord had brought him out of the prison . He said , “ Go tell these things to Jacob and the brethren . ” Then he left and went to another place .
44012018	When day came , there was no small commotion among the soldiers as to what had become of Peter .
44012019	After Herod made a search for him and did not find him , he interrogated the guards and commanded that they be led away to execution . Then he went down from Judea and stayed in Caesarea .
44012020	Now it happened that Herod was furious with the people of Tyre and Sidon . So they came to him , united . Having won over Blastus , the king’s personal aide , they began asking for peace — because their country was supplied with food from the king’s country .
44012021	On an appointed day , Herod donned his royal robes and , taking his seat upon the throne , began to make a speech to them .
44012022	The people were shouting , “ The voice of a god and not a human ! ”
44012023	Immediately , an angel of the Lord struck him down — because he did not give God the glory . And he was eaten by worms and died .
44012024	But the word of God kept on growing and multiplying .
44012025	And Barnabas and Saul returned to Jerusalem when they had fulfilled their service , taking along John ( who was also called Mark ) .
44013001	Now in the Antioch community , there were prophets and teachers : Barnabas , Simeon called Niger , Lucius the Cyrenian , Manaen ( brought up since childhood with Herod the Tetrarch ) , and Saul .
44013002	While they were serving the Lord and fasting , the Ruach ha-Kodesh said , “ Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them . ”
44013003	Then after fasting , praying , and laying hands on them , they sent them off .
44013004	So , sent out by the Ruach ha-Kodesh , they went down to Seleucia , and from there they sailed to Cyprus .
44013005	When they arrived at Salamis , they began to proclaim the word of God in the Jewish synagogues . They also had John as a helper .
44013006	When they had gone throughout the whole island as far as Paphos , they found a man who was a magician — a Jewish false prophet , whose name was Bar-Yeshua .
44013007	He was with the proconsul , Sergius Paulus , an intelligent man . This man summoned Barnabas and Saul and sought to hear the word of God .
44013008	But Elymas the magician ( for so his name is translated ) was opposing them , seeking to turn the proconsul away from the faith .
44013009	But Saul , who is also Paul , filled with the Ruach ha-Kodesh , fixed his gaze on him
44013010	and said , “ O you , full of all deceit and trickery , son of the devil , enemy of all righteousness — will you not stop making crooked the straight paths of the Lord ?
44013011	Now , behold , the hand of the Lord is upon you , and you shall be blind and not see the sun for awhile . ” Immediately , cloudiness and darkness fell upon him , and he went about seeking people to lead him by the hand .
44013012	When he saw what had happened , the proconsul believed , because he was astonished at the teaching about the Lord .
44013013	Setting sail from Paphos , Paul's company came to Perga in Pamphylia . John left them and returned to Jerusalem .
44013014	But they passed on from Perga and came to Antioch of Pisidia . Entering the synagogue on the Shabbat , they sat down .
44013015	After the reading of the Torah and the Prophets , the synagogue leaders sent to them , saying , “ Brethren , if you have any word of encouragement for the people , speak . ”
44013016	So Paul , standing up and motioning with his hand , said , “ Men of Israel and God-fearers , listen .
44013017	The God of this people Israel chose our fathers and made the people great during their stay in the land of Egypt , and with an outstretched arm He led them out of there .
44013018	For about forty years He put up with them in the wilderness .
44013019	And when He had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan , He gave their land as an inheritance —
44013020	all of this took about 450 years . After that , he gave them judges until Samuel the prophet .
44013021	Then they asked for a king , and God gave them Saul , son of Kish , of the tribe of Benjamin , for forty years .
44013022	After removing him , He raised up David to be their king . He also testified about him and said , ‘ I have found David , the son of Jesse , a man after My heart , who will do My will . ’
44013023	“ From this man’s seed , in keeping with His promise , God brought to Israel a Savior — Yeshua .
44013024	Before His coming , John had proclaimed an immersion of repentance to all the people of Israel .
44013025	As John was completing his service , he said , ‘ What do you suppose me to be ? I am not He . But behold , One is coming after me , whose sandal I’m not worthy to untie . ’
44013026	“ Brethren , sons of the family of Abraham and those among you who are God-fearers , it is to us the message of this salvation has been sent .
44013027	For those who live in Jerusalem and their rulers — not recognizing Him or the sayings of the Prophets that are read every Shabbat — fulfilled these words by condemning Him .
44013028	Though they found no charge worthy of a death sentence , they asked Pilate to have Him executed .
44013029	When they had carried out all that had been written about Him , they took Him down from the tree and laid Him in a tomb .
44013030	But God raised Him from the dead !
44013031	For many days He appeared to those who had come up from the Galilee to Jerusalem , who are now His witnesses to the people .
44013032	“ And we proclaim to you Good News — the promise to the fathers has arrived !
44013033	For God has fulfilled this promise to the children — to us — by raising up Yeshua , as it is also written in the second psalm : ‘ You are My Son . Today I have become Your Father . ’
44013034	“ But since He raised Him up from the dead , never to return to decay , He has spoken in this way , ‘ I will give you the holy and sure mercies of David . ’
44013035	Therefore He also says in another psalm , ‘ You will not permit Your Holy One to see decay . ’
44013036	For after David had served God’s purpose in his own generation , he went to sleep and was laid with his fathers and saw decay .
44013037	But the One whom God raised up did not see decay .
44013038	“ Therefore , let it be known to you , brethren , that through this One is proclaimed to you the removal of sins , including all those from which you could not be set right by the Torah of Moses .
44013039	Through this One everyone who keeps trusting is made righteous .
44013040	“ Be careful , then , so that what is said in the Prophets may not come upon you :
44013041	‘ Look , you scoffers , be amazed and vanish away . For I am doing a work in your days — a work you will never believe , even if someone tells it to you in detail . ’ ”
44013042	As Paul and Barnabas were going out , the people kept begging them to speak these things to them the next Shabbat .
44013043	When the synagogue meeting broke up , many of the Jewish people and God-fearing inquirers followed Paul and Barnabas , who were speaking with them and trying to persuade them to continue in the grace of God .
44013044	The following Shabbat , almost the entire city came together to hear the word of the Lord .
44013045	When the Jewish leaders saw the crowds , they were filled with jealousy and tried to contradict what Paul was saying by reviling him .
44013046	Both Paul and Barnabas spoke out boldly and said , “ It was necessary for the word of God to be spoken to you first . Since you reject it and judge yourselves unfit for eternal life — behold , we turn to the Gentiles .
44013047	For so the Lord has commanded us , ‘ I have placed you as a light to the nations , so that you may bring salvation to the end of the earth . ’ ”
44013048	When the Gentiles heard this , they were thrilled and glorified the word of the Lord ; and as many as had been inscribed for eternal life believed .
44013049	Now the word of the Lord spread throughout the whole region .
44013050	But the Jewish leaders incited the God-fearing women of high standing and the leading men of the city . They stirred up persecution against Paul and Barnabas , and they drove them out of their district .
44013051	But Paul and Barnabas shook the dust off their feet against them , and they went on to Iconium .
44013052	And the disciples were filled with joy and the Ruach ha-Kodesh .
44014001	Now in Iconium , the same thing happened — they entered as usual into the Jewish synagogue and spoke in such a way that a large number of Jewish and Greek people believed .
44014002	But the Jewish people who would not believe stirred up the Gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brethren .
44014003	So they stayed there a considerable time , speaking boldly in the Lord — who was testifying to the message of His grace , granting signs and wonders to come about by their hands .
44014004	But the population of the city split ; some were with the Jewish leaders and some were with the shlichim .
44014005	Now it happened that an attempt was made by both the Gentiles and Jewish people , along with their rulers , to abuse and stone them .
44014006	But they found out about it and fled to the Lycaonian cities of Lystra and Derbe and the surrounding countryside .
44014007	There they proclaimed the Good News .
44014008	Now a man was sitting in Lystra without strength in his feet , lame from birth , who had never walked .
44014009	This man heard Paul speaking . When Paul looked intently at him and saw that he had faith to be healed ,
44014010	he said with a loud voice , “ Stand right up ! On your feet ! ” And the man leaped up and began to walk around !
44014011	Now the crowd , seeing what Paul had done , lifted up their voices , saying in Lycaonian , “ The gods have become like men and come down to us ! ”
44014012	And they began calling Barnabas “ Zeus ” and Paul “ Hermes ” ( because he was the main speaker ) .
44014013	The priest of Zeus , whose temple was before the front gate of the city , brought bulls and garlands ; he wanted to offer a sacrifice with the people .
44014014	But when the shlichim Barnabas and Paul heard of it , they tore their clothes and rushed out among the crowd , crying out
44014015	and saying , “ Men , why are you doing these things ? We too are human , just like you ! We proclaim the Good News to you , telling you to turn from these worthless things to the living God , who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all that is in them .
44014016	In past generations He allowed all the nations to go their own ways .
44014017	Yet He did not leave Himself without a witness — He did good by giving you rain from heaven and fruitful seasons , filling your hearts with joy and gladness . ”
44014018	Even saying these things , they barely restrained the crowd from sacrificing to them .
44014019	But Jewish people came from Antioch and Iconium ; and after they won the crowd over and stoned Paul , they were dragging him out of the city , supposing him to be dead .
44014020	But while the disciples surrounded him , he got up and went back into the city . On the next day he left with Barnabas for Derbe .
44014021	After proclaiming the Good News to that city and making many disciples , they returned to Lystra and to Iconium and to Antioch .
44014022	They were strengthening the souls of the disciples , encouraging them to persevere in faith , and saying , “ It is through many persecutions that we must enter the kingdom of God . ”
44014023	When they had handpicked elders for them in every community , and prayed with fasting , they placed them in the care of the Lord — in whom they had put their trust .
44014024	Then they passed through Pisidia and came to Pamphyllia .
44014025	After speaking the message in Perga , they went down to Attalia .
44014026	From there they sailed back to Antioch ( where they had been entrusted to the gracious care of God for the work now completed ) .
44014027	When they arrived and gathered together Messiah’s community , they began to report all that God had done in helping them and that He had opened a door of faith to the Gentiles .
44014028	And they stayed quite awhile with the disciples .
44015001	Now some men coming down from Judea were teaching the brethren , “ Unless you are circumcised according to the custom of Moses , you cannot be saved . ”
44015002	When Paul and Barnabas had a big argument and debate with them , the brethren appointed Paul and Barnabas with some others from among them to go up to Jerusalem to the shlichim and elders about this issue .
44015003	So they were sent on their way by the Antioch community . They were passing through both Phoenicia and Samaria , describing in detail the conversion of the Gentiles , and they were bringing great joy to all the brethren .
44015004	When they arrived in Jerusalem , they were welcomed by the community and the shlichim and the elders . They reported all that God had done in helping them .
44015005	But some belonging to the party of the Pharisees who had believed stood up , saying , “ It is necessary to circumcise them and to command them to keep the Torah of Moses . ”
44015006	The shlichim and elders were gathered together to examine this issue .
44015007	After much debate , Peter stood up and said to them , “ Brethren , you know that in the early days God chose from among you , that by my mouth the Gentiles should hear the message of the Good News and believe .
44015008	And God , who knows the heart , testified to them by giving them the Ruach ha-Kodesh — just as He also did for us .
44015009	He made no distinction between us and them , purifying their hearts through faith .
44015010	Why then do you put God to the test by putting a yoke on the neck of the disciples — which neither our fathers nor we have been able to bear ?
44015011	But instead , we believe that we are saved through the grace of the Lord Yeshua , in the same way as they are . ”
44015012	Then the whole group became silent and were listening to Barnabas and Paul as they were describing in detail all the signs and wonders God had done through them among the Gentiles .
44015013	After they finished speaking , Jacob answered , “ Brethren , listen to me .
44015014	Simon has described how God first showed His concern by taking from the Gentiles a people for His Name .
44015015	The words of the Prophets agree , as it is written :
44015016	‘ After this I will return and rebuild the fallen tabernacle of David . I will rebuild its ruins and I will restore it ,
44015017	so that the rest of humanity may seek the Lord — namely all the Gentiles who are called by My name — says Adonai , who makes these things
44015018	known from of old . ’
44015019	Therefore , I judge not to trouble those from among the Gentiles who are turning to God —
44015020	but to write to them to abstain from the contamination of idols , and from sexual immorality , and from what is strangled , and from blood .
44015021	For Moses from ancient generations has had in every city those who proclaim him , since he is read in all the synagogues every Shabbat . ”
44015022	Then it seemed good to the shlichim and elders , with the whole community , to choose men from among themselves to send to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas . They sent Judah ( also called Barsabbas ) and Silas , leading men among the brethren ,
44015023	and this letter along with them : “ The shlichim and the elders , your brethren , To the Gentile brethren of Antioch , Syria , and Cilicia : Greetings !
44015024	Since we have heard that some from among us have troubled you with words disturbing to your souls , although we gave them no such authorization ,
44015025	it seemed good to us , having come to one accord , to select men to send to you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul —
44015026	men who have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Yeshua the Messiah .
44015027	We therefore have sent to you Judah and Silas , who themselves will report to you the same things by word of mouth .
44015028	It seemed good to the Ruach ha-Kodesh and to us not to place on you any greater burden than these essentials :
44015029	that you abstain from things offered to idols , from blood , from things strangled , and from sexual immorality . By keeping away from these things , you will do well . Shalom ! ”
44015030	So when they were sent off , they went down to Antioch ; and when they had gathered the whole group together , they delivered the letter .
44015031	The people read it and rejoiced over its encouragement .
44015032	Judah and Silas , prophets themselves , encouraged the brethren with a long message and strengthened them .
44015033	After spending some time there , they were sent off with shalom by the brethren to those who had sent them .
44015035	But Paul and Barnabas remained in Antioch , teaching and proclaiming the word of the Lord with many others .
44015036	After some days Paul said to Barnabas , “ Let’s return and visit the brethren in every city where we have proclaimed the word of the Lord , to see how they are . ”
44015037	Barnabas was planning to take along John , called Mark .
44015038	But Paul was insisting that they shouldn’t take him along — the one who had deserted them in Pamphylia , not accompanying them in the work .
44015039	A sharp disagreement took place , so that they split off from one another . Barnabas took Mark with him and sailed away to Cyprus .
44015040	But Paul selected Silas and went out , being entrusted by the brethren to the gracious care of the Lord .
44015041	He went through Syria and Cilicia , strengthening the communities .
44016001	Now Paul came to Derbe and Lystra . There was a disciple there named Timothy , son of a woman who was a Jewish believer and a Greek father ,
44016002	who was well-spoken of by the brethren at Lystra and Iconium .
44016003	Paul wanted this man to accompany him , and he took him and circumcised him for the sake of the Jewish people in those places — for they all knew that his father was Greek .
44016004	As they were traveling through the cities , they were handing down the rulings that had been decided upon by the shlichim and elders in Jerusalem , for them to keep .
44016005	So Messiah’s communities were strengthened in the faith and kept increasing daily in number .
44016006	They went through the region of Phrygia and Galatia , having been forbidden by the Ruach ha-Kodesh to speak the word in Asia .
44016007	When they came to Mysia , they were trying to proceed into Bithynia , but the Ruach of Yeshua would not allow them .
44016008	So they passed by Mysia and went down to Troas .
44016009	Now a vision appeared to Paul in the night . A man from Macedonia was standing and pleading with him , saying , “ Come over to Macedonia and help us ! ”
44016010	As soon as he had seen the vision , immediately we tried to go to Macedonia , concluding that God had called us to proclaim the Good News to them .
44016011	So we put out to sea from Troas and made a straight course for Samothrace , the next day on to Neapolis ,
44016012	and from there to Philippi — which is a leading city of the district of Macedonia as well as a Roman colony . We stayed in this city for several days .
44016013	On Yom Shabbat , we went outside the gate to the river , where we expected a place of prayer to be . We sat down and began speaking with the women who had gathered .
44016014	A woman named Lydia — a seller of purple cloth from the city of Thyatira , a God-fearer — was listening . The Lord opened her heart to respond to what Paul was saying .
44016015	When she was immersed , along with her household , she urged us , saying , “ If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord , come and stay at my house . ” And she insisted .
44016016	It so happened that as we were going to prayer , we met a slave girl who had a spirit of divination , who was bringing her masters much profit from her fortune-telling .
44016017	Following after Paul and us , she kept shouting , saying , “ These men are servants of El Elyon , who are proclaiming to you the way of salvation . ”
44016018	She kept doing this for many days . But Paul was irritated and turned and said to the spirit , “ I command you in the name of Messiah Yeshua to come out of her ! ” And it came out of her that very moment .
44016019	But when her masters saw that the hope of profit was gone , they grabbed Paul and Silas and dragged them into the marketplace before the authorities .
44016020	And when they brought them to the chief authorities , they said , “ These men are throwing our city into an uproar ! Being Jewish ,
44016021	they advocate customs which are not permitted for us to accept or practice , being Romans . ”
44016022	Then the crowd joined in the attack on them . So the chief authorities ripped their clothes off them and commanded them to be beaten with rods .
44016023	After inflicting many blows on them , they threw them into prison , ordering the jailer to guard them securely .
44016024	Having received this charge , he threw them into the inner prison and fastened their feet in the stocks .
44016025	But about midnight , Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God , and the prisoners were listening to them .
44016026	Suddenly there was such a great earthquake that the foundations of the prison were shaken . Immediately all the doors were unlocked , and everyone’s chains came loose .
44016027	When the jailer woke up and saw the prison doors opened , he drew his sword and was about to kill himself , supposing the prisoners had escaped .
44016028	But Paul cried out with a loud voice , saying , “ Don’t harm yourself ! We’re all here ! ”
44016029	The jailer called for lights and rushed in ; and trembling with fear , he fell down before Paul and Silas .
44016030	After he brought them out , he said , “ Sirs , what must I do to be saved ? ”
44016031	They said , “ Put your trust in the Lord Yeshua and you will be saved — you and your household ! ”
44016032	Then they spoke the word of the Lord to him , along with everyone in his household .
44016033	He took them that very hour and washed their wounds , and at once he was immersed — he and all his household .
44016034	The jailer brought them to his house and set food before them , and he was overjoyed that he with his entire household had put their trust in God .
44016035	When day came , the chief authorities sent their police officers , saying , “ Release those men . ”
44016036	But the jailer reported these words to Paul , saying , “ The chief authorities have sent orders to release you . So come out now , and go in shalom . ”
44016037	But Paul said to the officers , “ They have beaten us publicly without a trial — men who are Roman citizens — and have thrown us into prison . And now they are sending us away secretly ? No ! Let them come themselves and lead us out ! ”
44016038	The police officers reported these words to the chief authorities . They became afraid when they heard they were Romans ,
44016039	so they came and apologized to them . After they escorted them out , they kept begging them to leave the city .
44016040	When Paul and Silas went out of the prison , they visited Lydia’s house . And when they saw the brethren , they encouraged them and then departed .
44017001	After passing through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they came to Thessalonica , where there was a Jewish synagogue .
44017002	As was his custom , Paul went to the Jewish people ; and for three Shabbats , he debated the Scriptures with them .
44017003	He opened them and gave evidence that Messiah had to suffer and rise from the dead , saying , “ This Yeshua , whom I declare to you , is the Messiah . ”
44017004	Some of them were convinced and became attached to Paul and Silas , as were a large number of the God-fearing Greeks and no small number of the leading women .
44017005	But some of the Jewish people became jealous . Taking some wicked fellows of the marketplace and gathering a crowd , they stirred the city into an uproar . They attacked Jason’s house , trying to bring Paul and Silas out to the mob .
44017006	When they did not find them , they instead began dragging Jason and some of the brethren before the city officials , shouting , “ These men who have upset the world have come here too ,
44017007	and Jason has welcomed them ! They are all acting against the decrees of Caesar , saying there is another king , Yeshua . ”
44017008	Hearing these things , the crowd and the city officials were confused .
44017009	But after receiving bail from Jason and the rest , they released them .
44017010	As soon as it was night , the brethren sent Paul and Silas to Berea . Upon arrival , they made their way to the Jewish synagogue .
44017011	Now these were more noble-minded than those in Thessalonica , because they received the message with goodwill , searching the Scriptures each day to see whether these things were true .
44017012	Therefore many of them believed , as well as quite a few prominent Greek women and men .
44017013	But when the Jewish people of Thessalonica learned that the word of God had been proclaimed by Paul in Berea , they came there too , agitating and inciting the people .
44017014	Then the brethren immediately sent Paul away to the sea , but Silas and Timothy remained there .
44017015	Those escorting Paul brought him as far as Athens . After receiving an order for Silas and Timothy to come to him as soon as possible , they left .
44017016	Now while Paul was waiting for them in Athens , his spirit was aroused within him when he saw that the city was full of idols .
44017017	So he was debating in the synagogue with the Jewish people and the God-fearers , as well as in the marketplace every day with all who happened to be there .
44017018	Also some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers were conversing with him . Some were saying , “ What’s this babbler trying to say ? ” while others , “ He seems to be a proclaimer of foreign deities ” — because he was proclaiming the Good News of Yeshua and the resurrection .
44017019	So they took Paul to the Aereopagus , saying , “ May we know what this new teaching is that you are talking about ?
44017020	For you are bringing some strange things to our ears , so we want to know what these things mean . ”
44017021	Now all the Athenians and foreigners visiting there used to pass their time doing nothing but telling or hearing something new .
44017022	So Paul stood in the middle of the Aereopagus and said , “ Men of Athens , I see that in all ways you are very religious .
44017023	For while I was passing through and observing the objects of your worship , I even found an altar with this inscription : ‘ To an Unknown God . ’ Therefore what you worship without knowing , this I proclaim to you .
44017024	The God who made the world and all things in it , since He is Lord of heaven and earth , does not live in temples made by hands .
44017025	Nor is He served by human hands , as if He needed anything , since He Himself gives to everyone life and breath and all things .
44017026	From one He made every nation of men to live on the face of the earth , having set appointed times and the boundaries of their territory .
44017027	They were to search for Him , and perhaps grope around for Him and find Him . Yet He is not far from each one of us ,
44017028	for ‘ In Him we live and move and have our being . ’ As some of your own poets have said , ‘ For we also are His offspring . ’
44017029	Since we are His offspring , we ought not to suppose the Deity is like gold or silver or stone , an engraved image of human art and imagination .
44017030	Although God overlooked the periods of ignorance , now He commands everyone everywhere to repent .
44017031	For He has set a day on which He will judge the world in righteousness , through a Man whom He has appointed . He has brought forth evidence of this to all men , by raising Him from the dead . ”
44017032	Now when they heard about the resurrection of the dead , some began scoffing . But others said , “ We will hear from you again about this . ”
44017033	So Paul left from their midst .
44017034	But some men joined with him and believed — among them Dionysius ( a member of the council of the Areopagus ) , a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
44018001	After these things , Paul left Athens and went to Corinth .
44018002	There he found a Jewish man named Aquila — a native of Pontus having recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla , because Claudius had commanded all Jewish people to leave Rome . Paul went to see them ;
44018003	and because he was of the same trade , he stayed with them and began working , for by trade they were tent-makers .
44018004	And he was debating every Shabbat in the synagogue , trying to persuade both Jewish and Greek people .
44018005	Now when Silas and Timothy arrived from Macedonia , Paul became occupied with the message , urgently testifying to the Jewish people that Yeshua is the Messiah .
44018006	But when they resisted and reviled him , he shook out his garments and said , “ Your blood be upon your own heads — I am clean ! From now on , I will go to the Gentiles . ”
44018007	After leaving there , Paul went into the house of a man named Titius Justus , a God-fearer whose house was next door to the synagogue .
44018008	Crispus , the synagogue leader , put his faith in the Lord , along with his whole household . And many of the Corinthians , upon hearing , were believing and being immersed .
44018009	Now the Lord said to Paul through a vision in the night , “ Do not be afraid , but speak and do not be silent !
44018010	For I am with you and no one shall attack you to harm you — many people in this city are for Me . ”
44018011	So he stayed a year and six months , teaching the word of God among them .
44018012	But while Gallio was proconsul of Achaia , the Jewish leaders made a united attack against Paul and brought him before the judgment seat ,
44018013	saying , “ This man persuades men to worship God contrary to the Torah . ”
44018014	But when Paul was about to open his mouth , Gallio said to the Jewish people , “ If it were a matter of wrongdoing or a vicious crime , there would be a reason to put up with you , O Jews .
44018015	But since it is issues about words , names , and your own law , see to it yourselves . I do not wish to be a judge of these . ”
44018016	And he drove them from the judgment seat .
44018017	Then they all grabbed Sosthenes , the synagogue leader , and began beating him in front of the judgment seat . But Gallio paid no attention to these things .
44018018	Paul , having stayed many more days , said farewell to the brethren and set sail to Syria , and with him were Priscilla and Aquila . At Cenchrea Paul had his hair cut off , for he was keeping a vow .
44018019	When they arrived at Ephesus , Paul left Priscilla and Aquila there . But he himself went into the synagogue and debated with the Jewish people .
44018020	When they asked him to stay longer , he declined ,
44018021	instead taking leave of them while saying , “ God willing , I'll return to you again . ” He set sail from Ephesus .
44018022	After landing at Caesarea , he went up and greeted Messiah’s community ; then he went down to Antioch .
44018023	After spending some time there , he departed and went one place after another throughout the region of Galatia and Phrygia , strengthening all the disciples . Discipling New Leaders
44018024	Now a Jewish man named Apollos , a native of Alexandria , came to Ephesus . He was a learned man , well versed in the Scriptures .
44018025	He had been instructed in the way of the Lord . With a fervent spirit , he was speaking and teaching accurately the facts about Yeshua — while only being acquainted with the immersion of John .
44018026	This man began speaking out boldly in the synagogue . But when Priscilla and Aquila heard him , they took him aside and explained the way of God more accurately .
44018027	When Apollos wanted to cross over to Achaia , the brethren encouraged him and wrote to the disciples to welcome him . Upon arrival , he greatly helped those who by grace had believed .
44018028	For he powerfully refuted the Jewish people in public , demonstrating through the Scriptures that the Messiah was Yeshua .
44019001	While Apollos was at Corinth , Paul traveled through the upper region and came to Ephesus . He found some disciples
44019002	and said to them , “ Did you receive the Ruach ha-Kodesh when you believed ? ” They replied to him , “ No , we’ve never even heard that there is a Ruach ha-Kodesh .
44019003	He said , “ Into what were you immersed ? ” They said , “ Into John's immersion . ”
44019004	Paul said , “ John immersed with an immersion of repentance , telling the people that they should believe in the One coming after him — that is , in Yeshua . ”
44019005	When they heard this , they were immersed in the name of the Lord Yeshua .
44019006	And when Paul laid hands upon them , the Ruach ha-Kodesh came upon them , and they began speaking in tongues and prophesying .
44019007	In all , there were about twelve men .
44019008	Paul went into the synagogue and for three months spoke boldly , debating and persuading them about the kingdom of God .
44019009	But when they were hardening and refusing to believe , speaking evil of the Way before the whole group , he withdrew from them , taking the disciples with him , debating daily in the hall of Tyrannus .
44019010	This continued for two years , so that all the residents of Asia heard the word of the Lord — Jewish as well as Greek people .
44019011	God was doing extraordinary miracles by Paul’s hands ,
44019012	so that even handkerchiefs and aprons that touched his skin were brought to the sick , and the diseases left them and the evil spirits went out of them .
44019013	But some traveling Jewish exorcists also tried to invoke the name of the Lord Yeshua , saying , “ I charge you by the Yeshua whom Paul preaches . ”
44019014	Seven sons of a Jewish ruling kohen named Sceva were doing this .
44019015	But the evil spirit answered them , “ I know Yeshua and I know about Paul , but who are you ? ”
44019016	Then the man with the evil spirit sprang at them , subduing and overpowering all of them , so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded .
44019017	This became known to all who lived in Ephesus , both Jewish and Greek people . Fear fell upon them all , and the name of the Lord Yeshua was being magnified .
44019018	Many also of those who had believed came confessing and recounting their practices .
44019019	And many of those who practiced magic arts brought their books together in a heap , burning them before everyone . They totaled the value of the books and found it to be about fifty thousand pieces of silver .
44019020	So the word of the Lord was growing in power and prevailing . Idol-Makers Start a Riot
44019021	Now after these things were accomplished , Paul resolved in the Ruach to go to Jerusalem after passing through Macedonia and Achaia , saying , “ After I have been there , I must also see Rome . ”
44019022	So after sending two who were assisting him , Timothy and Erastus , he himself stayed in Asia for a while .
44019023	Around that time , there arose no small uproar concerning the Way .
44019024	For a man named Demetrius — a silversmith , a maker of silver shrines of Artemis — was providing no small amount of business to the craftsmen .
44019025	He gathered these together , along with those of related occupations , and he said , “ Men , you know that our wealth is from this business .
44019026	You see and hear that not only in Ephesus but also throughout all Asia , Paul has persuaded and perverted a considerable crowd , saying that handmade gods are not gods at all .
44019027	Not only is there a danger that this trade of ours might come into disrepute , but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis might be considered as nothing . She whom all Asia and the world worships might even be thrown down from her majesty . ”
44019028	When they heard , they were filled with fury and began shouting , “ Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! ”
44019029	The city was filled with confusion . They rushed into the theater , dragging with them Gaius and Aristarchus , Macedonians who were travel companions of Paul .
44019030	Paul was wishing to enter among the crowd , but the disciples would not let him .
44019031	Some of the chiefs of Asia , being his friends , sent to him and begged him not to surrender himself in the theater .
44019032	Now some cried out one thing , some another , for the assembly was in confusion . Most did not know why they had come together .
44019033	Some of the crowd solicited Alexander , whom the Jewish people put forward . Alexander motioned with his hand . He wished to offer a defense to the crowd .
44019034	But recognizing that he was Jewish , for about two hours they all with one voice cried out , “ Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! ”
44019035	After the town clerk quieted the crowd , he said , “ Men of Ephesus , what man is there who doesn’t know that the city of the Ephesians is temple keeper of the great Artemis and of her image fallen from heaven ?
44019036	Since these things are undeniable , you must be calm and do nothing reckless .
44019037	For you have brought these men here who are neither sacrilegious nor revilers of our goddess .
44019038	If Demetrius and the craftsmen with him have a complaint against anyone , the courts are open and there are proconsuls . Let them accuse them .
44019039	But if you seek anything further , it will be settled in the lawful assembly .
44019040	For we are in danger of being charged with rioting today , there being no reason which we are able to give to justify this mob . ” Upon saying this , he dismissed the assembly .

44020001	After the uproar ended , Paul sent for the disciples ; and when he had encouraged them and said farewell , he departed to go to Macedonia .
44020002	When he had passed through these parts and given them a great word of encouragement , he came to Greece ,
44020003	where he spent three months . When a plot was formed against him by the Jewish leaders as he was about to sail to Syria , he decided to return via Macedonia .
44020004	Sopater of Berea , son of Pyrrhus , accompanied him ; as well as Aristarchus and Secundus of Thessalonica ; Gaius of Derbe , and Timothy ; Tychicus and Trophimus of Asia .
44020005	These went on ahead and were waiting for us at Troas .
44020006	But we sailed from Philippi after the Days of Matzah . In five days we came to them in Troas , where we stayed for seven days .
44020007	Now on the first day of the week , we gathered to break bread . Paul was talking with them , intending to leave the next day , so he prolonged his speech till midnight .
44020008	There were many lamps in the upper chamber where we were meeting .
44020009	Now a young man named Eutychus was sitting in a windowsill , sinking into a deep sleep as Paul kept on talking . Overcome by sleep , he fell from the third story and was picked up — dead .
44020010	But Paul went down , fell on him and threw his arms around him . He said , “ Don’t be upset , for his life is within him . ”
44020011	After he went back up and broke the bread and ate , he talked with them a long while until daybreak and then left .
44020012	So they took the boy away alive , greatly relieved . Prophetic Warnings
44020013	But we went on ahead to the ship and set sail for Assos , intending to take Paul aboard there — for so he had arranged , intending himself to travel there by land .
44020014	When he met us at Assos , we took him on board and went to Mitylene .
44020015	Sailing from there , we arrived the next day opposite Chios ; the next day we crossed over to Samos , and the day after that we came to Miletus .
44020016	For Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus so that he might not spend much time in Asia , because he was hurrying to be in Jerusalem , if possible , by the day of Shavuot .
44020017	From Miletus , dispatching someone to Ephesus , he called for the elders of the community .
44020018	When they came to him , he said to them , “ You yourselves know how I behaved among you all the time from the first day I set foot in Asia ,
44020019	serving the Lord with all humility and tears and trials which fell upon me through the plots of the Jewish leaders .
44020020	I did not shrink back from proclaiming to you anything that was profitable , teaching you publicly as well as from house to house ,
44020021	testifying to both Jewish and Greek people repentance to God and trust in our Lord Yeshua .
44020022	“ And now , look , bound by the Ruach , I am going to Jerusalem — not knowing what will happen to me there ,
44020023	except that the Ruach ha-Kodesh bears witness to me from city to city , saying that bondage and afflictions await me .
44020024	However , I don't consider my life of any value , except that I might finish my course and the office I received from the Lord Yeshua , to declare the Good News of the grace of God .
44020025	“ Now , look ! I know that none of you , among whom I have gone proclaiming the kingdom , will ever see my face again .
44020026	Therefore , I testify to you this day that I am innocent of the blood of all .
44020027	For I did not shrink back from declaring to you the whole purpose of God .
44020028	“ Take care of yourselves and all the flock of which the Ruach ha-Kodesh has made you overseers , to shepherd the community of God — which He obtained with the blood of His own .
44020029	I know that after my departure , savage wolves will come in among you , not sparing the flock .
44020030	Even from among yourselves will arise men speaking perversions , to draw the disciples away after themselves .
44020031	Therefore be alert , remembering that night and day for three years I did not stop warning you with tears .
44020032	“ Now I commit you to God and the word of His grace , which is strong to build you up and to give you the inheritance among all who have been made holy .
44020033	I coveted no one’s silver or gold or clothing .
44020034	You yourselves know that these hands of mine have provided for my own needs as well as for those with me .
44020035	In all things I have shown you an object lesson — that by hard work one must help the weak , remembering the words of the Lord Yeshua , that He Himself said , ‘ It is more blessed to give than to receive . ’ ”
44020036	When he had said these things , he knelt down and prayed with them all .
44020037	They all began weeping and falling upon Paul’s neck and kissing him ,
44020038	grieving most of all over the statement he made that they would never see his face again . Then they accompanied him to the ship .
44021001	After tearing ourselves away from them and setting sail , we set a straight course to Cos , the next day to Rhodes , and from there to Patara .
44021002	Finding a ship crossing to Phoenicia , we went aboard and set sail .
44021003	When we came in sight of Cyprus , passing it by on the left , we kept sailing to Syria and landed at Tyre — for there the ship was to unload the cargo .
44021004	We looked up the disciples and stayed there seven days . They kept telling Paul through the Ruach not to set foot in Jerusalem .
44021005	When our days there were over , we departed and went on our journey . They all , with wives and children , accompanied us until we were outside the city . After kneeling down on the shore and praying ,
44021006	we said farewell to one another . Then we boarded the ship , and they returned home .
44021007	When we had finished the trip from Tyre , we arrived at Ptolemais . We greeted the brethren and stayed with them for one day .
44021008	On the next day , we departed and came to Caesarea . We entered the home of Philip , the proclaimer of Good News , who was one of the seven , and we stayed with him .
44021009	Now this man had four virgin daughters who prophesied .
44021010	While we stayed there for a number of days , a prophet named Agabus came down from Judea .
44021011	He came to us , took Paul’s belt , tied his own hands and feet , and said , “ The Ruach ha-Kodesh says this : ‘ In this way shall the Jewish people in Jerusalem bind the man who owns this belt and deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles . ’ ”
44021012	When we heard these things , both we and the local people urged Paul not to go up to Jerusalem .
44021013	Then Paul responded , “ What are you doing , weeping and breaking my heart ? For I am ready not only to be bound but to die for the name of the Lord Yeshua ! ”
44021014	Since he would not be persuaded , we fell silent , saying only , “ May the Lord’s will be done . ”
44021015	After these days , we packed and started going up to Jerusalem .
44021016	Some of the disciples from Caesarea also went with us , bringing us to Mnason of Cyprus — one of the early disciples by whom we might be hosted .
44021017	When we arrived in Jerusalem , the brethren welcomed us gladly .
44021018	On the next day , Paul went in with us to Jacob ; all the elders were present .
44021019	After greeting them , he reported to them in detail what God had done among the Gentiles through his service .
44021020	And when they heard , they began glorifying God . They said , “ You see , brother , how many myriads there are among the Jewish people who have believed — and they are all zealous for the Torah .
44021021	They have been told about you — that you teach all the Jewish people among the Gentiles to forsake Moses , telling them not to circumcise their children or to walk according to the customs .
44021022	What’s to be done then ? No doubt they will hear that you have come .
44021023	“ So do what we tell you . We have four men who have a vow on themselves .
44021024	Take them , and purify yourself along with them and pay their expenses , so that they may shave their heads . That way , all will realize there is nothing to the things they have been told about you , but that you yourself walk in an orderly manner , keeping the Torah .
44021025	“ As for Gentiles who have believed , however , we have written by letter what we decided — for them to abstain from what is offered to idols , and from blood , and from what is strangled , and from immorality . ”
44021026	The next day Paul took the men , purifying himself along with them . He went into the Temple , announcing when the days of purification would be completed and the sacrifice would be offered for each one of them .
44021027	When the seven days were about to be completed , the Jewish leaders from Asia saw Paul in the Temple and began stirring up the whole crowd . They grabbed him ,
44021028	shouting , “ Men of Israel , help ! This is the man who is teaching all men everywhere against our people and the Torah and this place . Besides , he has even brought Greeks into the Temple and defiled this holy place ! ”
44021029	For they had previously seen Trophimus the Ephesian in the city with him , and they assumed that Paul had brought him into the Temple .
44021030	The whole city was stirred up , and the people rushed together . They grabbed Paul and dragged him out of the Temple , and the gates were shut at once .
44021031	As they were trying to kill him , news came to the commander of the cohort that all Jerusalem was in chaos .
