44021032	Immediately he took soldiers and centurions and rushed down to them . Upon seeing the commander and the soldiers , they stopped beating Paul .
44021033	Then the commander came up , arrested Paul , ordered him to be bound with two chains , and began investigating what he had done .
44021034	Some in the crowd shouted one thing , and some another . As he could not determine the facts because of the uproar , he ordered him to be brought into headquarters .
44021035	When he came to the steps , he had to be carried by the soldiers because of the violence of the crowd .
44021036	For the multitude of people that followed kept shouting , “ Away with him ! ”
44021037	As Paul was about to be brought into the headquarters , he said to the commander , “ Can I say something to you ? ” The commander said , “ You know Greek ?
44021038	Then you’re not the Egyptian who stirred up a rebellion some time ago — and led four thousand men of the Assassins out into the desert ? ”
44021039	Paul said , “ I am a Jewish man from Tarsus in Cilicia , a citizen of no insignificant city . I beg you , let me speak to the people . ”
44021040	When the commander had given him permission , Paul stood on the steps and motioned to the people with his hand . When there was a great hush , he spoke to them in Aramaic , saying :
44022001	“ Brethren and fathers , listen to my defense which I now present to you . ”
44022002	When they heard that Paul was addressing them in Aramaic , they became even more quiet . Then he said ,
44022003	“ I am a Jewish man , born in Tarsus of Cilicia but brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel , trained strictly according to the Torah of our fathers , being zealous for God just as all of you are today .
44022004	I persecuted this Way to the death , arresting both men and women and throwing them in prisons —
44022005	as the kohen gadol and all the council of elders can testify about me . I also received letters from them to the brethren , and I went to Damascus to bring back to Jerusalem even those who were there in chains — to be punished .
44022006	“ But it happened that as I was traveling and drawing near to Damascus , about noon a great light from heaven suddenly flashed all around me .
44022007	I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to me , ‘ Saul , Saul , why do you persecute Me ? ’
44022008	“ I answered , ‘ Who are you , Lord ? ’ “ He said to me , ‘ I am Yeshua ha-Natzrati , whom you are persecuting . ’
44022009	“ Now those who were with me saw the light , but did not understand the voice of the One who was speaking to me .
44022010	So I said , ‘ What shall I do , Lord ? ’ “ And the Lord said to me , ‘ Get up , and go to Damascus . There you will be told all that you have been appointed to do . ’
44022011	“ But since I could not see because of the brilliance of that light , I was led by the hand by those who were with me and came into Damascus .
44022012	Then a certain Ananias — a devout man according to the Torah , well spoken of by all the Jewish people living there —
44022013	came to me . Standing before me , he said to me , ‘ Brother Saul , look up ! ’ In that very moment , I looked and saw him !
44022014	“ And he said , ‘ The God of our fathers handpicked you to know His will — to see the Righteous One and to hear an utterance from His mouth .
44022015	For you will be a witness for Him to all people of what you have seen and heard .
44022016	Now why are you waiting ? Get up and be immersed , and wash away your sins , calling on His Name . ’
44022017	“ It happened that when I returned to Jerusalem and was praying in the Temple , I fell into a trance ;
44022018	and I saw Him saying to me , ‘ Hurry ! Get out of Jerusalem quickly , because they will not accept your witness about Me . ’
44022019	“ And I said , ‘ Lord , they themselves know that in one synagogue after another , I was imprisoning and beating those trusting in You .
44022020	Even when the blood of Your witness Stephen was spilled , I too was standing by and approving , and guarding the clothing of those who were killing him . ’
44022021	“ And he said to me , ‘ Go ! For I will send you far away to the Gentiles . ’ ”
44022022	Up to this statement they listened to him . Then they raised their voices , saying , “ Away from the earth with this fellow ! For he’s not fit to live ! ”
44022023	As they were crying out and flinging off their cloaks and throwing dust into the air ,
44022024	the commander ordered Paul to be brought into headquarters . He said Paul should be examined by lashing , so that he might find out why they were shouting against him so .
44022025	But when they stretched him out with straps , Paul said to the centurion standing there , “ Is it legal for you to scourge a man who is a Roman citizen without due process ? ”
44022026	Now when the centurion heard this , he went to the commander and reported it , saying , “ What are you going to do ? For this man is Roman . ”
44022027	The commander came and said to him , “ Tell me , are you Roman ? ” And he said , “ Yes . ”
44022028	The commander answered , “ I bought this citizenship for a large sum . ” Paul said , “ But I was born so . ”
44022029	Therefore , those who were about to interrogate him instantly drew back from him . And the commander also was afraid when he found out that Paul was a Roman and that he had bound him .
44022030	But on the next day , desiring to know exactly why Paul had been accused by the Judeans , he released him and commanded the ruling kohanim and all the Sanhedrin to meet together . And he brought Paul and set him before them .
44023001	Paul , looking intently at the Sanhedrin , said , “ Brethren , I have lived my life in all good conscience for God up to this day . ”
44023002	But the kohen gadol Ananias ordered those standing by him to strike him on the mouth .
44023003	Then Paul said to him , “ God is going to strike you on the mouth , you whitewashed wall ! Do you sit judging me according to the Torah , and yet in violation of the Torah you order me to be struck ? ”
44023004	Those standing nearby said , “ Do you insult God’s kohen gadol ? ”
44023005	Paul said , “ I didn't know , brethren , that he is the kohen gadol . For it has been written , ‘ You shall not speak evil of a ruler of your people . ’ ”
44023006	But recognizing that one group was Sadducees and the other Pharisees , Paul began crying out in the Sanhedrin , “ Brethren , I am a Pharisee , a son of Pharisees ! I am on trial because of the hope of the resurrection of the dead ! ”
44023007	When he said this , a dispute broke out between the Pharisees and Sadducees , and the assembly was divided .
44023008	For the Sadducees say there is no resurrection or angel or spirit , but the Pharisees affirm them all .
44023009	Then there was a great uproar . Some of the Torah scholars of the Pharisees’ party stood up and protested sharply , “ We find nothing wrong with this man ! What if a spirit or angel has spoken to him ? ”
44023010	As a big dispute was developing , the commander was afraid that Paul would be torn to pieces by them . So he ordered the soldiers to go down and take him by force from among them and to bring him into headquarters .
44023011	The following night the Lord stood beside Paul and said , “ Take courage ! For just as you have testified about Me in Jerusalem , so you must also testify in Rome ! ”
44023012	When it was day , the Judean leaders formed a conspiracy . They bound themselves by an oath not to eat or drink until they had killed Paul .
44023013	There were more than forty who formed this plot .
44023014	They went to the ruling kohanim and elders and said , “ We have bound ourselves with a solemn oath to taste nothing until we have killed Paul .
44023015	So now you and the Sanhedrin serve notice to the commander to bring him down to you — like you are about to investigate his case more thoroughly . But we are ready to kill him before he comes near . ”
44023016	But the son of Paul’s sister heard of their ambush . He went into the headquarters and told Paul .
44023017	Paul called one of the centurions and said , “ Take this young man to the commander , for he has a message for him . ”
44023018	So the centurion took him and led him to the commander and said , “ The prisoner Paul called me and asked me to bring this young man to you , as he has something to say to you . ”
44023019	The commander took him by the hand , stepped aside , and began asking him privately , “ What is it that you have to report to me ? ”
44023020	And he said , “ The Judean leaders have agreed to ask you to bring Paul down to the Sanhedrin tomorrow — as if they are about to investigate more thoroughly about him .
44023021	But do not give in to them , for more than forty of them have bound themselves by an oath not to eat or drink until they have killed him . Even now , they are ready and waiting for your consent . ”
44023022	So the commander dismissed the young man , charging him , “ Tell no one that you have informed me about these things . ”
44023023	Calling two of his centurions , he said , “ At the third hour of the night , prepare two hundred soldiers , along with seventy horsemen and two hundred spearmen , to proceed as far as Caesarea .
44023024	Also provide mounts for Paul to ride , so that he might be brought safely to Felix the governor . ”
44023025	He wrote a letter to this effect :
44023026	“ Claudius Lysias , To the Most Excellent Governor Felix : Greetings !
44023027	This man was seized by the Judean leaders and was about to be killed by them , when I came on the scene with the soldiers and rescued him , having learned that he is a Roman citizen .
44023028	Desiring to know the charge of which they were accusing him , I brought him down to their Sanhedrin .
44023029	I found that he was accused concerning issues of their law , but charged with nothing worthy of death or imprisonment .
44023030	When I was informed that there was a plot against the man , I sent him to you immediately , also ordering his accusers to state before you what they have against him . ”
44023031	So the soldiers , in keeping with their orders , took Paul and brought him by night to Antipatris .
44023032	On the next day , they returned to headquarters , leaving the horsemen to go on with him .
44023033	When they came to Caesarea and delivered the letter to the governor , they also presented Paul before him .
44023034	Upon reading the letter , the governor asked what province he was from . When he learned that Paul was from Cilicia ,
44023035	he said , “ I will give you a hearing when your accusers have arrived also . ” Then he gave orders for Paul to be guarded in Herod’s Praetorium .
44024001	After five days , the kohen gadol Ananias came down with some of the elders and an attorney named Tertullus . They brought formal charges against Paul before the governor .
44024002	When Paul was called in , Tertullus began to accuse him , saying , “ We are enjoying much peace through you , and reforms are introduced for this nation because of your foresight .
44024003	We acknowledge this , most excellent Felix , in every way and every place with all gratitude .
44024004	“ But in order that I may not weary you any longer , I beg you in your kindness to hear us briefly .
44024005	For we have found this man to be a pest , stirring up riots among all the Jewish people throughout the world , and a ringleader of the sect of the Natzratim .
44024006	He even tried to defile the Temple , but we seized him .
44024008	By examining him yourself , you will be able to learn from him all these things about which we accuse him . ”
44024009	The Judean leaders also joined in the attack , affirming that these things were true .
44024010	When the governor nodded for him to speak , Paul responded : “ Knowing that you have been judge over this nation for many years , I gladly make my own defense .
44024011	As you can verify , it is no more than twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem to worship .
44024012	They did not find me arguing with anyone or inciting a riot — not in the Temple or in the synagogues or anywhere else in the city .
44024013	Nor can they prove to you the charges they now bring against me .
44024014	“ But this I confess to you , that according to the Way ( which they call a sect ) , I worship the God of our fathers , believing everything written in the Torah and the Prophets .
44024015	In God I have a hope — which these men also wait for — that there will surely be a resurrection of both the righteous and the unrighteous .
44024016	“ Therefore I do my best always to have a clear conscience before both God and men .
44024017	Now after several years , I came to bring tzedakah to my country for the poor and to present offerings .
44024018	As I was doing this , they found me in the Temple , having been purified — without any crowd or uproar .
44024019	But there were some Jewish people from Asia , who ought to be here before you to press charges if they have anything against me .
44024020	Or let these men themselves tell what wrongdoing they found when I stood before the Sanhedrin —
44024021	except for this one cry I shouted out while standing among them : ‘ It is about the resurrection of the dead that today I am on trial before you . ’ ”
44024022	But Felix , having a rather extensive knowledge of the Way , put them off , saying , “ When Lysias the commander comes down , I will rule on your case . ”
44024023	Then he gave the centurion orders for Paul to be kept in custody and yet have some freedom , and not to prevent any of his friends from attending to his needs .
44024024	Now some days later Felix came with his wife Drusilla , who was Jewish . He sent for Paul and listened to him speak about faith in Messiah Yeshua .
44024025	But as he was arguing about righteousness , self-control , and the coming judgment , Felix became afraid and said , “ Go away for now ! When I find time , I will summon you . ”
44024026	At the same time too , he was hoping that money would be given to him by Paul ; so he sent for him frequently and would talk with him .
44024027	But after two years had passed , Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus ; and wishing to do the Judean leaders a favor , Felix left Paul in prison .
44025001	Three days after Festus arrived in the province , he went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea .
44025002	There the ruling kohanim and the leading Judeans brought charges against Paul . They were urging him ,
44025003	asking a favor — to have Paul sent to Jerusalem , planning an ambush to kill him on the road .
44025004	Festus then answered that Paul was being guarded at Caesarea , and that he himself was about to go there shortly .
44025005	“ So then , ” he said , “ let the prominent men among you go down with me ; and if there is any wrong in the man , let them accuse him . ”
44025006	After spending not more than eight to ten days with them , he went down to Caesarea . The next day , he sat on the judgment seat and ordered Paul to be brought in .
44025007	When he arrived , the Judeans who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him , bringing against him many serious charges which they could not prove .
44025008	Paul said in his defense , “ I have committed no offense against the Torah of the Jewish people , or against the Temple , or against Caesar . ”
44025009	But Festus , wanting to do the Jewish leaders a favor , said to Paul , “ Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem to be tried before me ? ”
44025010	But Paul said , “ I am standing before Caesar's judgment seat , where I ought to be tried . I have done no wrong to the Judeans , as you very well know .
44025011	If then I am in the wrong and have committed anything worthy of death , I do not seek to escape death . But if there is nothing to their charges , no one can turn me over to them . I appeal to Caesar ! ”
44025012	Then when Festus had consulted with the council , he responded , “ You have appealed to Caesar — to Caesar you shall go ! ”
44025013	Now after several days had passed , King Agrippa and Bernice arrived at Caesarea to pay their respects to Festus .
44025014	While they were staying there several days , Festus laid Paul’s case before the king , saying , “ There is a man left behind as a prisoner by Felix .
44025015	When I was in Jerusalem , the ruling kohanim and elders of the Judeans brought charges against him , asking for a judgment against him .
44025016	I answered them that it is not Roman practice to turn over anyone before the accused meets his accusers face to face and has an opportunity to make his defense concerning the charges .
44025017	So when they came together here , I did not delay , but on the next day sat on the judgment seat and ordered the man to be brought in .
44025018	When the accusers stood up , they were not bringing a charge of what crimes I suspected .
44025019	Instead , they had certain issues with him about their own religion and about a certain Yeshua , who had died , whom Paul claimed to be alive .
44025020	“ Since I was at a loss as to how to investigate these matters , I asked whether he was willing to go to Jerusalem to be tried there in regard to them .
44025021	But when Paul appealed to be held in custody for the decision of His Majesty the Emperor , I ordered him to be held until I could send him to Caesar . ”
44025022	Then Agrippa said to Festus , “ I would like to hear the man myself . ” “ Tomorrow , ” he said , “ you shall hear him . ”
44025023	So on the next day , Agrippa and Bernice came with great pageantry . They entered the audience hall with the commanders and the most prominent men of the city . Then at the order of Festus , Paul was brought in .
44025024	Festus said , “ King Agrippa and all present with us , you see this man about whom the whole Judean population petitioned me , both in Jerusalem and here , shouting out that he ought not live any longer .
44025025	But I found that he had done nothing deserving of death ; and when he himself appealed to His Majesty the Emperor , I decided to send him .
44025026	Yet I have nothing specific to write to my lord about him . Therefore I have brought him before you — and especially before you , King Agrippa — so that after the investigation has taken place , I might have something to write .
44025027	For it seems illogical to me when sending a prisoner , not to report also the charges against him . ”
44026001	Agrippa said to Paul , “ It is permitted for you to speak for yourself . ” Then Paul stretched out his hand and began his defense .
44026002	“ Concerning all I am accused of by the Judean leaders , I consider myself fortunate , King Agrippa , that it is before you that I am about to make my defense today —
44026003	since you are especially knowledgeable about all Jewish customs and issues . Therefore I beg you to listen patiently to me .
44026004	“ Now all the Jewish people have known my manner of life ever since my youth , starting from the beginning in my own nation and also in Jerusalem .
44026005	They have known about me for a long time — if they were willing to testify — that according to the strictest sect of our religion , I lived as a Pharisee .
44026006	“ Yet now I stand here being judged for the hope in the promise made by God to our fathers .
44026007	It is the promise that our twelve tribes hope to attain , as they earnestly worship night and day . And for this hope I am accused by Jewish people , O King !
44026008	Why is it judged incredible by any of you that God raises the dead ?
44026009	“ In fact , I myself thought it was necessary to do many things in opposition to the name of Yeshua ha-Natzrati .
44026010	And that is what I did in Jerusalem . Not only did I lock up many of the kedoshim in prisons by the authority I received from the ruling kohanim , but I cast my vote against them when they were being condemned to death .
44026011	I tried to cause them to blaspheme by punishing them often in the synagogues . In furious rage against them , I persecuted them even in foreign cities .
44026012	“ While journeying to Damascus with the authority and commission of the ruling kohanim ,
44026013	at midday , O King , I saw on the road a light from heaven , brighter than the sun , shining around me and those traveling with me .
44026014	When we had all fallen to the ground , I heard a voice saying to me in Aramaic , ‘ Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting Me ? It is hard for you to kick against goads ! ’
44026015	“ Then I said , ‘ Who are you , Lord ? ’ “ And the Lord said , ‘ I am Yeshua — whom you are persecuting .
44026016	But get up , and stand on your feet . For I have appeared to you for this purpose — to appoint you as a servant and witness to the things you have seen as well as to the things I will yet reveal to you .
44026017	I will rescue you from your own people , and from the Gentiles to whom I am sending you ,
44026018	to open their eyes — so they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of satan to God , that they may receive release from sins as well as a place among those who are made holy through trusting in Me . ’
44026019	“ Therefore , O King Agrippa , I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision .
44026020	Rather , I kept declaring — first to those in Damascus , and then Jerusalem and throughout all the region of Judea , and also the Gentiles — that they should repent and turn to God , performing deeds consistent with that repentance .
44026021	“ For this reason some Judeans seized me in the Temple and tried to put me to death .
44026022	Since I have had God’s help , to this day I have stood here testifying to both small and great . I am saying nothing but what the Prophets and Moses said was going to happen —
44026023	that the Messiah was to suffer and that , being first to rise from the dead , He would proclaim light both to our people and to the nations . ”
44026024	As Paul was thus making his defense , Festus says with a loud voice , “ You’re crazy , Paul ! Your great learning is driving you insane ! ”
44026025	But Paul declares , “ I am not insane , most noble Festus ! Rather I am speaking the sober truth .
44026026	For the king knows about these things , and I speak freely to him , since I am convinced that none of these things escape his notice — for this was not done in a corner .
44026027	King Agrippa , do you believe the Prophets ? I know that you do believe ! ”
44026028	Agrippa said to Paul , “ In a short time you are trying to persuade me to be Messianic ! ”
44026029	And Paul said , “ Whether short or long , I would pray to God that not only you , but also all who hear me today would be such as I am — except for these chains ! ”
44026030	Then the king stood up , as well as the governor , Bernice , and those sitting with them .
44026031	When they had gone away , they began talking among themselves , saying , “ This man is doing nothing deserving of death or chains . ”
44026032	Then Agrippa said to Festus , “ This man could have been set free , if he had not appealed to Caesar . ”
44027001	When it was decided that we should sail for Italy , they handed Paul and some other prisoners over to a centurion named Julius , of the Augustan Cohort .
44027002	So we boarded a ship from Adramyttium , which was about to sail to the ports along the coast of Asia , and we set out to sea — accompanied by Aristarchus , a Macedonian from Thessalonica .
44027003	The next day we set down at Sidon . Julius , treating Paul kindly , let him go to his friends to receive care .
44027004	Setting out to sea from there , we sailed under the shelter of Cyprus , because the winds were against us .
44027005	When we had sailed across the open sea along the coast of Cilicia and Pamphylia , we came down to Myra in Lysia .
44027006	There the centurion found a ship from Alexandria sailing for Italy and put us on board .
44027007	Sailing slowly for a number of days , with difficulty we made it to Cnidus . As the wind did not allow us to go further , we sailed under the shelter of Crete , off Salmone .
44027008	Coasting along it with difficulty , we came to a place called Fair Havens , near the city of Lasea .
44027009	Since considerable time had passed and the voyage was already dangerous because the Fast had already gone by , Paul kept warning them ,
44027010	telling them , “ Men , I can see that the voyage is about to end in disaster and great loss — not only of the cargo and the ship , but also of our lives ! ”
44027011	But the centurion was persuaded more by the pilot and the captain of the ship than by what was said by Paul .
44027012	And because the harbor was unsuitable for wintering , the majority reached a decision to set out to sea from there — if somehow they might reach Phoenix , a harbor of Crete facing northeast and southeast , and spend the winter there .
44027013	When the south wind blew gently , supposing they had obtained their purpose , they raised the anchor and started coasting along the shore by Crete .
44027014	But before long , a hurricane-force wind called “ the Northeaster ” swept down from the island .
44027015	When the ship was caught and could not face into the wind , we gave way to it and were driven along .
44027016	As we ran under the shelter of a small island called Cauda , we were barely able to get control of the dinghy .
44027017	When the crew had hoisted it up , they made use of ropes to undergird the ship . Then fearing they might run aground on the Syrtis , they let down the anchor and so were driven along .
44027018	But as we were violently battered by the storm , the next day they began throwing cargo overboard .
44027019	On the third day , they threw out the ship’s gear with their own hands .
44027020	With neither sun nor stars appearing for many days , and no small storm pressing on us , all hope of our survival was vanishing .
44027021	As they had long been without food , Paul stood up in their midst and said , “ Men , you should have listened to me and not sailed from Crete , to avoid this disaster and loss .
44027022	Yet now I urge you to take heart , for there will be no loss of life among you — but only of the ship .
44027023	For this very night , there came to me an angel of the God to whom I belong and whom I serve .
44027024	He said , ‘ Do not fear , Paul . You must stand before Caesar ; and indeed , God has granted you all who are sailing with you . ’
44027025	So take heart , men , for I trust God that it will be exactly as I have been told .
44027026	But we must run aground on some island . ”
44027027	Now when the fourteenth night had come , as we were drifting across the Adriatic Sea , about midnight the sailors began to sense that they were nearing some land .
44027028	So they took soundings and found the water was twenty fathoms deep . A bit farther along , they took another sounding and found it was fifteen fathoms deep .
44027029	Fearing that we might run aground on the rocks , they threw out four anchors from the stern . They were longing for day to come .
44027030	Now the sailors were trying to escape from the ship and had lowered the dinghy into the sea , pretending they were going to put out anchors from the bow .
44027031	Paul said to the centurion and the soldiers , “ Unless these men remain on the ship , you cannot be saved ! ”
44027032	Then the soldiers cut away the ropes of the dinghy and let it drift away .
44027033	As day was about to dawn , Paul urged them all to take some food , saying , “ Today is the fourteenth day that you have kept waiting and going without food , having taken nothing .
44027034	Therefore , I urge you to take some food — for this is for your survival , since not one of you will lose a hair from his head . ”
44027035	And when he had said these things , he took bread , gave thanks to God before them all , broke it , and began to eat .
44027036	Then all were encouraged and took some food themselves .
44027037	( In all we were 276 persons on the ship . )
44027038	When they had eaten enough , they began to lighten the ship , throwing the wheat into the sea .
44027039	Then when daylight came , they did not recognize the land ; but they noticed a bay with a beach , where they planned to run the ship aground if they could .
44027040	So they cut off the anchors and left them in the sea , while loosening the ropes of the rudders at the same time . Then , hoisting the forward sail to the wind , they made for the beach .
44027041	But they struck a sandbar between the seas and ran the ship aground . The bow stuck fast and remained immovable , and the stern began to break up by the pounding of the waves .
44027042	The plan of the soldiers was to kill the prisoners , so that none of them would escape by swimming away .
44027043	But the centurion , wanting to save Paul , kept them from carrying out their plan . He ordered those able to swim to throw themselves overboard first and get to land —
44027044	and the rest to get there on boards and pieces of the ship . And in this way all were brought safely to land .
44028001	Once safely ashore , we learned that the island was called Malta .
44028002	The natives showed us unusual kindness . Because it had started raining and it was cold , they kindled a fire and welcomed us all .
44028003	But when Paul had gathered a bundle of brushwood and placed it on the fire , a viper came out because of the heat and fastened on his hand .
44028004	When the natives saw the snake hanging from his hand , they began saying to one another , “ No doubt this man is a murderer ! Though he has been saved from the sea , Justice has not allowed him to live . ”
44028005	However , Paul shook the snake off into the fire and suffered no harm .
44028006	They were expecting him to swell up or suddenly fall down dead — but after they waited a long time and saw no harm come to him , they changed their minds and began to say he was a god .
44028007	Now in the vicinity around that place were lands belonging to the most prominent man of the island , named Publius . He welcomed us and hosted us warmly for three days .
44028008	It so happened that the father of Publius was lying in bed sick with a fever and dysentery . Paul visited him and , when he had prayed and laid hands on him , he healed him .
44028009	After this happened , the rest of the sick on the island started coming and getting healed .
44028010	They also heaped honors on us ; and when we sailed , they put on board all the supplies we needed .
44028011	After three months , we set sail in a ship from Alexandria that had wintered at the island , with the Twin Brothers as its figurehead .
44028012	Setting down at Syracuse , we stayed there three days .
44028013	From there we got underway and reached Rhegium ; and a day later a south wind came up , and on the second day we came to Puteoli .
44028014	There we found some brethren , and we were invited to stay with them for seven days . And in this way we came to Rome .
44028015	Now the brethren there , when they heard about us , came as far as the Forum of Appius and the Three Taverns to meet us . When Paul saw them , he gave thanks to God and took courage .
44028016	When we entered Rome , Paul was permitted to remain in his own quarters , with a soldier guarding him . Paul Keeps Spreading the Good News
44028017	It happened that after three days , Paul called together those who were the prominent Jewish leaders . When they had gathered he said to them , “ Brethren , although I had done nothing against our people or the customs of our fathers , I was delivered as a prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans .
44028018	When they examined me , they wanted to release me because there was no basis for the death penalty .
44028019	But when the Judean leaders protested , I was forced to appeal to Caesar — not that I had any charge to bring against my own nation .
44028020	For this reason , therefore , I have requested to see you and to speak with you — since it is for the hope of Israel that I am bearing this chain . ”
44028021	They said to him , “ We have received no letters from Judea about you , and none of the brethren coming here has reported or spoken any evil about you .
44028022	But we think it appropriate to hear from you about what you think . For indeed , it is known to us that regarding this sect , it is spoken against everywhere . ”
44028023	They set a day to meet Paul and came to him at his quarters in large numbers . From morning until evening he was explaining everything to them , testifying about the kingdom of God and trying to persuade them about Yeshua from both the Torah of Moses and the Prophets .
44028024	Some were convinced by what he said , while others refused to believe .
44028025	So when they disagreed among themselves , they began leaving after Paul had said one last statement : “ The Ruach ha-Kodesh rightly spoke through Isaiah the prophet to your fathers ,
44028026	saying , ‘ Go to this people and say , “ You will keep on hearing but will never understand ; you will keep looking , but will never see .
44028027	For the heart of this people has become dull , their ears can barely hear , and they have shut their eyes . Otherwise they might see with their eyes , hear with their ears , and understand with their hearts . Then they would turn back , and I would heal them . ” ’
44028028	Therefore let it be known to you that this salvation of God has been sent to the Gentiles , and they will listen ! ”
44028030	Paul remained two whole years in his own rented quarters and continued to welcome all who came to him —
44028031	proclaiming the kingdom of God and teaching about the Lord Yeshua the Messiah with all boldness and without hindrance .
45001001	Paul , a slave of Messiah Yeshua , called to be a shaliach and set apart for the Good News of God ,
45001002	which He announced beforehand through His prophets in the Holy Scriptures .
45001003	Concerning His Son , He came into being from the seed of David according to the flesh .
45001004	He was appointed Ben-Elohim in power according to the Ruach of holiness , by the resurrection from the dead . He is Messiah Yeshua our Lord .
45001005	Through Him we have received grace and the office of shaliach , to bring about obedience of faith among all the nations on behalf of His name .
45001006	And you also are called to Yeshua the Messiah .
45001007	To all those in Rome , loved by God , called to be kedoshim : Grace to you and shalom from God our Father and the Lord Yeshua the Messiah !
45001008	First , I thank my God through Messiah Yeshua for all of you , because your faithfulness is made known throughout the whole world .
45001009	For God is my witness , whom I serve with my spirit in the Good News of His Son . How unceasingly I make mention of you ,
45001010	always pleading in my prayers , if somehow by God’s will now at last I will be granted a good journey to come to you .
45001011	For I long to see you , so I may share with you some spiritual gift to strengthen you .
45001012	That is to say , we would be encouraged together by one another’s faithfulness — both yours and mine .
45001013	I do not want you to be unaware , brethren , that many times I planned to come to you ( though I was prevented until now ) — so I might have some fruit among you also , just as I have among the rest of the nations .
45001014	I have an obligation to both Greeks and barbarians , to both the wise and the foolish .
45001015	So I am eager to proclaim the Good News also to you who are in Rome .
45001016	For I am not ashamed of the Good News , for it is the power of God for salvation to everyone who trusts — to the Jew first and also to the Greek .
45001017	In it the righteousness of God is revealed , from trust to trust . As it is written , “ But the righteous shall live by emunah . ”
45001018	For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men . In unrighteousness they suppress the truth ,
45001019	because what can be known about God is plain to them — for God has shown it to them .
45001020	His invisible attributes — His eternal power and His divine nature — have been clearly seen ever since the creation of the world , being understood through the things that have been made . So people are without excuse —
45001021	for even though they knew God , they did not glorify Him as God or give Him thanks . Instead , their thinking became futile , and their senseless hearts were made dark .
45001022	Claiming to be wise , they became fools .
45001023	They exchanged the glory of the immortal God for an image in the form of mortal man and birds and four-footed beasts and creeping things .
45001024	Therefore God gave them over in the evil desires of their hearts to impurity , to dishonor their bodies with one another .
45001025	They traded the truth of God for a lie and worshiped and served the creation rather than the Creator , who is blessed forever . Amen .
45001026	For this reason God gave them up to shameful passions . Even their women exchanged natural relations for what is against nature .
45001027	Likewise the men abandoned natural relations with women and were burning with passion toward one another — men committing shameful acts with other men and receiving in themselves the due penalty for their error .
45001028	And just as they did not see fit to recognize God , God gave them over to a depraved mind , to do what is not fitting .
45001029	They became filled with all unrighteousness , wickedness , greed , evil . They are full of envy , murder , strife , deceit , malice . They are gossips ,
45001030	slanderers , God-haters , insolent , haughty , boastful , inventors of evil , disobedient to parents .
45001031	They are foolish , faithless , heartless , ruthless .
45001032	Though they know God’s righteous decree — that those who practice such things deserve death — they not only do them but also approve of others who practice the same .
45002001	Therefore you are without excuse , O man — every one of you who is judging . For by whatever you judge another , you condemn yourself . For you who judge practice the same things .
45002002	We know that God’s judgment on those who practice such things is based on truth .
45002003	But you , O man — judging those practicing such things yet doing the same — do you suppose that you will escape the judgment of God ?
45002004	Or do you belittle the riches of His kindness and tolerance and patience — not realizing that God’s kindness leads you to repentance ?
45002005	But by your hard and unrepentant heart , you are storing up wrath for yourself on the day of wrath , when God’s righteous judgment is revealed .
45002006	He will pay back each person according to his deeds .
45002007	To those who by perseverance in doing good are seeking glory , honor , and immortality — eternal life .
45002008	But to those who are self-seeking and do not obey the truth , but obey unrighteousness — wrath and fury .
45002009	There will be trouble and hardship for every human soul that does evil — to the Jew first and also to the Greek .
45002010	But there will be glory , honor , and shalom to everyone who does good — to the Jew first and also to the Greek .
45002011	For there is no partiality with God .
45002012	For all who have sinned outside of Torah will also perish outside of Torah , and all who have sinned according to Torah will be judged by Torah .
45002013	For it is not the hearers of Torah who are righteous before God ; rather , it is the doers of Torah who will be justified .
45002014	For when Gentiles , who do not have the Torah , do by nature the things of the Torah , they are a law to themselves even though they do not have the Torah .
45002015	They show that the work of the Torah is written in their hearts , their conscience bearing witness and their thoughts switching between accusing or defending them
45002016	on the day when God judges the secrets of men according to my Good News through Messiah Yeshua .
45002017	But if you call yourself Jewish and rely upon the Torah and boast in God
45002018	and know His will and determine what matters because you are instructed from the Torah —
45002019	and you are sure that you are a guide to the blind , a light to those who are in darkness ,
45002020	a corrector of the foolish , a teacher of the immature , having in the Torah the embodiment of knowledge and the truth —
45002021	you then who teach another , do you not teach yourself ? You who preach not to steal , do you steal ?
45002022	You who say not to commit adultery , do you commit adultery ? You who detest idols , do you rob temples ?
45002023	You who take pride in the Torah , through your violation of the Torah , do you dishonor God ?
45002024	For as it is written , “ the name of God is slandered among the nations because of you . ”
45002025	Circumcision is indeed worthwhile if you keep the Torah ; but if you break the Torah , your circumcision has become uncircumcision .
45002026	Therefore , if the uncircumcised keeps the righteous decrees of the Torah , will not his uncircumcision be counted as circumcision ?
45002027	Indeed , the one not circumcised physically who fulfills the Torah will judge you who — even with the written code and circumcision — break the Torah .
45002028	For one is not a Jew who is one outwardly , nor is circumcision something visible in the flesh .
45002029	Rather , the Jew is one inwardly , and circumcision is of the heart — in Ruach not in letter . His praise is not from men , but from God .
45003001	Then what is the advantage of being Jewish ? Or what is the benefit of circumcision ?
45003002	Much in every way . First of all , they were entrusted with the sayings of God .
45003003	So what if some did not trust ? Will their lack of faith nullify God’s faithfulness ?
45003004	May it never be ! Let God be true even if every man is a liar , as it is written , “ that You may be righteous in Your words and prevail when You are judged . ”
45003005	But if our unrighteousness demonstrates the righteousness of God , what shall we say ? God is not unrighteous to inflict wrath , is He ? ( I am speaking in human terms . )
45003006	May it never be ! For otherwise , how will God judge the world ?
45003007	But if by my lie the truth of God abounds to His glory , why am I still judged as a sinner ?
45003008	And why not say , “ Let us do evil , so that good may come ” — just as we are being slandered and as some claim that we say . Their condemnation is deserved !
45003009	What then ? Are we better than they ? No , not at all . For we have already made the case that all — both Jewish and Greek people — are under sin .
45003010	As it is written , “ There is no one righteous — no , not one .
45003011	There is no one who understands , no one who seeks after God .
45003012	All have turned aside ; together they have become worthless . There is no one who does good — no , not even one !
45003013	Their throat is an open grave ; with their tongues they keep deceiving . The poison of vipers is under their lips .
45003014	Their mouth is full of cursing and bitterness .
45003015	Their feet are swift to shed blood .
45003016	Ruin and misery are in their paths ,
45003017	and the way of shalom they have not known .
45003018	There is no fear of God before their eyes . ”
45003019	Now we know that whatever the Torah says , it says to those within the Torah , so that every mouth may be shut and the whole world may become accountable to God .
45003020	For no human , on the basis of Torah observance , will be set right in His sight — for through the Torah comes awareness of sin .
45003021	But now God’s righteousness apart from the Torah has been revealed , to which the Torah and the Prophets bear witness —
45003022	namely , the righteousness of God through putting trust in Messiah Yeshua , to all who keep on trusting . For there is no distinction ,
45003023	for all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God .
45003024	They are set right as a gift of His grace , through the redemption that is in Messiah Yeshua .
45003025	God set forth Yeshua as an atonement , through faith in His blood , to show His righteousness in passing over sins already committed .
45003026	Through God’s forbearance , He demonstrates His righteousness at the present time — that He Himself is just and also the justifier of the one who puts his trust in Yeshua .
45003027	Where , then , is boasting ? It is excluded . By what principle ? Of works ? No , but by the principle of faith .
45003028	For we consider a person to be set right apart from Torah observance .
45003029	Is God the God of the Jewish people only ? Is He not also the God of the Gentiles ? Yes , of the Gentiles also .
45003030	Since God is One , He will set right the circumcised by faith and the uncircumcised through faith .
45003031	Do we then nullify the Torah through faithfulness ? May it never be ! On the contrary , we uphold the Torah .
45004001	What then shall we say that Abraham , our forefather according to the flesh , has found ?
45004002	For if Abraham was set right by works , he has something to boast about — but not before God .
45004003	For what does the Scripture say ? “ Abraham believed God , and it was credited to him as righteousness . ”
45004004	Now to the one who works , the pay is not credited as a gift , but as what is due .
45004005	But to the one who does not work , but trusts in Him who justifies the ungodly , his trust is credited as righteousness —
45004006	just as David also speaks of the blessing on the man to whom God credits righteousness apart from works :
45004007	“ Blessed are those whose lawless deeds are forgiven and whose sins are covered .
45004008	Blessed is the man whose sin Adonai will never count against him . ”
45004009	Is this blessing then only on the circumcised , or also on the uncircumcised ? For we say , “ trust was credited to Abraham as righteousness . ”
45004010	In what state then was it credited ? While circumcised , or uncircumcised ? Not while circumcised , but while uncircumcised !
45004011	And he received the sign of circumcision as a seal of the righteousness of the trust he had while he was uncircumcised , so he might be the father of all who are trusting while uncircumcised — that righteousness might be credited to them as well .
45004012	Also he is the father of the circumcised , to those not only circumcised but also walking in the footsteps of the trust of our father Abraham before his circumcision .
45004013	For the promise to Abraham or to his seed — to become heir of the world — was not through law , but through the righteousness based on trust .
45004014	For if those who are of the Torah are heirs , trust has become empty and the promise is made ineffective .
45004015	For the Torah brings about wrath ; but where there is no law , neither is there a violation .
45004016	For this reason it depends on trust , so that the promise according to grace might be guaranteed to all the offspring — not only to those of the Torah but also to those of the faith of Abraham . He is the father of us all
45004017	( as it is written , “ I have made you a father of many nations ” ) . He is our father in the sight of God in whom he trusted , who gives life to the dead and calls into existence that which does not exist .
45004018	In hope beyond hope , he trusted that he would become the father of many nations according to what was spoken — “ So shall your descendants be . ”
45004019	And without becoming weak in faith , he considered his own body — as good as dead , since he was already a hundred years old — and the deadness of Sarah’s womb .
45004020	Yet he did not waver in unbelief concerning the promise of God . Rather , he was strengthened in faith , giving glory to God .
45004021	He was fully convinced that what God has promised , He also is able to do .
45004022	That is why “ it was credited to him as righteousness . ”
45004023	Now not only for his sake was it written that it was credited to him ,
45004024	but for our sake as well . It is credited to us as those who trust in Him who raised Yeshua our Lord from the dead .
45004025	He was handed over for our transgressions and raised up for the sake of setting us right .
45005001	Therefore , having been made righteous by trusting , we have shalom with God through our Lord Yeshua the Messiah .
45005002	Through Him we also have gained access by faith into this grace in which we stand and boast in the hope of God’s glory .
45005003	And not only that , but we also boast in suffering — knowing that suffering produces perseverance ;
45005004	and perseverance , character ; and character , hope .
45005005	And hope does not disappoint , because God’s love has been poured into our hearts through the Ruach ha-Kodesh who was given to us .
45005006	For while we were still helpless , at the right time Messiah died for the ungodly .
45005007	For rarely will anyone die for a righteous man — though perhaps for a good man someone might even dare to die .
45005008	But God demonstrates His own love toward us , in that while we were yet sinners , Messiah died for us .
45005009	How much more then , having now been set right by His blood , shall we be saved from God’s wrath through Him .
45005010	For if , while we were yet enemies , we were reconciled to God through the death of His Son , how much more , having been reconciled , shall we be saved by His life .
45005011	And not only that , but we also boast in God through our Lord Yeshua the Messiah , through whom we have now received reconciliation .
45005012	So then , just as sin came into the world through one man and death through sin , in the same way death spread to all men because all sinned .
45005013	For up until the Torah , sin was in the world ; but sin does not count as sin when there is no law .
45005014	Nevertheless death reigned from Adam until Moses , even over those who had not sinned in a manner similar to the violation of Adam , who is a pattern of the One to come .
45005015	But the gracious gift is not like the transgression . For if many died because of the transgression of one man , how much more did the grace of God overflow to many through the gift of one Man — Yeshua the Messiah .
45005016	Moreover , the gift is not like what happened through the one who sinned . For on the one hand , the judgment from one violation resulted in condemnation ; but on the other hand , the gracious gift following many transgressions resulted in justification .
45005017	For if by the one man’s transgression , death reigned through the one , how much more shall those who receive the overflow of grace and the gift of righteousness reign in life through the One , Messiah Yeshua .
45005018	So then , through the transgression of one , condemnation came to all men ; likewise , through the righteousness of one came righteousness of life to all men .
45005019	For just as through the disobedience of one man , many were made sinners , so also through the obedience of one man , many will be set right forever .
45005020	Now the Torah came in so that transgression might increase . But where sin increased , grace overflowed even more —
45005021	so that just as sin reigned in death , so also grace might reign through righteousness , to eternal life through Messiah Yeshua our Lord .
45006001	What shall we say then ? Are we to continue in sin so that grace may abound ?
45006002	May it never be ! How can we who died to sin still live in it ?
45006003	Or do you not know that all of us who were immersed into Messiah Yeshua were immersed into His death ?
45006004	Therefore we were buried together with Him through immersion into death — in order that just as Messiah was raised from the dead by the glory of the Father , so we too might walk in newness of life .
45006005	For if we have become joined together in the likeness of His death , certainly we also will be joined together in His resurrection —
45006006	knowing our old man was crucified with Him so that the sinful body might be done away with , so we no longer serve sin .
45006007	For he who has died is set free from sin .
45006008	Now if we have died with Messiah , we believe that we shall also live with Him .
45006009	We know that Messiah , having been raised from the dead , no longer dies ; death no longer is master over Him .
45006010	For the death He died , He died to sin once for all ; but the life He lives , He lives to God .
45006011	So also continually count yourselves both dead to sin and alive to God in Messiah Yeshua .
45006012	Therefore do not let sin rule in your mortal body so that you obey its desires .
45006013	And do not keep yielding your body parts to sin as tools of wickedness ; but yield yourselves to God as those alive from the dead , and your body parts as tools of righteousness to God .
45006014	For sin shall not be master over you , for you are not under law but under grace .
45006015	What then ? Shall we sin because we are not under law but under grace ? May it never be !
45006016	Do you not know that to whatever you yield yourselves as slaves for obedience , you are slaves to what you obey — whether to sin resulting in death , or to obedience resulting in righteousness ?
45006017	But thanks be to God that though you were slaves of sin , you wholeheartedly obeyed the form of teaching under which you were placed ;
45006018	and after you were set free from sin , you became enslaved to righteousness .
45006019	I speak in human terms because of the weakness of your flesh . For just as you yielded your body parts as slaves to uncleanness and lawlessness , leading to more lawlessness , so now yield your body parts as slaves to righteousness , resulting in holiness .
45006020	For when you were slaves of sin , you were free with regard to righteousness .
45006021	So then , what outcome did you have that you are now ashamed of ? For the end of those things is death .
45006022	But now , having been set free from sin and having become enslaved to God , you have your fruit resulting in holiness . And the outcome is eternal life .
45006023	For sin’s payment is death , but God’s gracious gift is eternal life in Messiah Yeshua our Lord .
45007001	Or do you not know , brethren ( for I speak to those who know law ) , that the law is master over a person as long as he lives ?
45007002	For the married woman is bound by law to her husband while he lives ; but if the husband dies , she is released from the law concerning the husband .
45007003	So then , if she is joined to another man while her husband is living , she will be called an adulteress . But if her husband dies , she is free from the law — so she is not an adulteress , though she is joined to another man .
45007004	Therefore , my brethren , you also were made dead to the Torah through the body of Messiah , so that you might be joined to another — the One who was raised from the dead — in order that we might bear fruit for God .
45007005	For when we were in the flesh , the sinful passions that came through the Torah were working in our body parts to bear fruit for death .
45007006	But now we have been released from the law , having died to what confined us , so that we serve in the new way of the Ruach and not in the old way of the letter .
45007007	What shall we say then ? Is the Torah sin ? May it never be ! On the contrary , I would not have known sin except through the Torah . For I would not have known about coveting if the Torah had not said , “ You shall not covet . ”
45007008	But sin , taking an opportunity , worked in me through the commandment all kinds of coveting . For apart from the Torah , sin is dead .
45007009	Once I was alive apart from the Torah ; but when the commandment came , sin came to life
45007010	and I died . The commandment meant for life was found to cause death .
45007011	Sin , taking an opportunity through the commandment , deceived me and through it killed me .
45007012	So then , the Torah is holy , and the commandment is holy and righteous and good .
45007013	Therefore did that which is good become death to me ? May it never be ! Rather it was sin working death in me — through that which is good — so that sin might be shown to be sin , and that through the commandment sin might become utterly sinful .
45007014	For we know that the Torah is spiritual ; but I am of the flesh , sold to sin .
45007015	For I do not understand what I am doing — for what I do not want , this I practice ; but what I hate , this I do .
45007016	But if I do what I do not want to do , then I agree with the Torah — that it is good .
45007017	So now it is no longer I doing it , but sin dwelling in me .
45007018	For I know that nothing good dwells in me — that is , in my flesh . For to will is present in me , but to do the good is not .
45007019	For the good that I want , I do not do ; but the evil that I do not want , this I practice .
45007020	But if I do what I do not want , it is no longer I doing it , but sin that dwells in me .
45007021	So I find the principle — that evil is present in me , the one who wants to do good .
45007022	For I delight in the Torah of God with respect to the inner man ,
45007023	but I see a different law in my body parts , battling against the law of my mind and bringing me into bondage under the law of sin which is in my body parts .
45007024	Miserable man that I am ! Who will rescue me from this body of death ?
45007025	Thanks be to God — it is through Messiah Yeshua our Lord ! So then , with my mind I myself serve the Torah of God ; but with my flesh , I serve the law of sin .
45008001	Therefore , there is now no condemnation for those who are in Messiah Yeshua .
45008002	For the law of the Ruach of life in Messiah Yeshua has set you free from the law of sin and death .
45008003	For what was impossible for the Torah — since it was weakened on account of the flesh — God has done . Sending His own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh and as a sin offering , He condemned sin in the flesh —
45008004	so that the requirement of the Torah might be fulfilled in us , who do not walk according to the flesh but according to the Ruach .
45008005	For those who live according to the flesh set their minds on the things of the flesh , but those who live according to the Ruach set their minds on the things of the Ruach .
45008006	For the mindset of the flesh is death , but the mindset of the Ruach is life and shalom .
45008007	For the mindset of the flesh is hostile toward God , for it does not submit itself to the law of God — for it cannot .
45008008	So those who are in the flesh cannot please God .
45008009	However , you are not in the flesh but in the Ruach — if indeed the Ruach Elohim dwells in you . Now if anyone does not have the Ruach of Messiah , he does not belong to Him .
45008010	But if Messiah is in you , though the body is dead because of sin , yet the spirit is alive because of righteousness .
45008011	And if the Ruach of the One who raised Yeshua from the dead dwells in you , the One who raised Messiah Yeshua from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies through His Ruach who dwells in you .
45008012	So then , brethren , we do not owe anything to the flesh , to live according to the flesh .
45008013	For if you live according to the flesh , you must die ; but if by the Ruach you put to death the deeds of the body , you shall live .
45008014	For all who are led by the Ruach Elohim , these are sons of God .
45008015	For you did not receive the spirit of slavery to fall again into fear ; rather , you received the Ruach of adoption , by whom we cry , “ Abba ! Father ! ”
45008016	The Ruach Himself bears witness with our spirit that we are children of God .
45008017	And if children , also heirs — heirs of God and joint-heirs with Messiah — if indeed we suffer with Him so that we may also be glorified with Him .
45008018	For I consider the sufferings of this present time not worthy to be compared with the coming glory to be revealed to us .
45008019	For the creation eagerly awaits the revelation of the sons of God .
45008020	For the creation was subjected to futility — not willingly but because of the One who subjected it — in hope
45008021	that the creation itself also will be set free from bondage to decay into the glorious freedom of the children of God .
45008022	For we know that the whole creation groans together and suffers birth pains until now —
45008023	and not only creation , but even ourselves . We ourselves , who have the firstfruits of the Ruach , groan inwardly as we eagerly wait for adoption — the redemption of our body .
45008024	For in hope we were saved . But hope that is seen is not hope . For who hopes for what he sees ?
45008025	But if we hope for what we do not see , then we eagerly wait for it with perseverance .
45008026	In the same way , the Ruach helps in our weakness . For we do not know how to pray as we should , but the Ruach Himself intercedes for us with groans too deep for words .
45008027	And He who searches the hearts knows the mind of the Ruach , because He intercedes for the kedoshim according to the will of God .
45008028	Now we know that all things work together for good for those who love God , who are called according to His purpose .
45008029	For those whom He foreknew He also predestined to be conformed to the image of His Son , so that He might be the firstborn among many brethren .
45008030	And those whom He predestined , He also called ; and those whom He called , He also justified ; and those whom He justified , He also glorified .
45008031	What then shall we say in view of these things ? If God is for us , who can be against us ?
45008032	He who did not spare His own Son but gave Him up for us all , how shall He not also with Him freely give us all things ?
45008033	Who shall bring a charge against God’s elect ? It is God who justifies .
45008034	Who is the one who condemns ? It is Messiah , who died , and moreover was raised , and is now at the right hand of God and interceding for us .
45008035	Who shall separate us from the love of Messiah ? Shall tribulation , or distress , or persecution , or famine , or nakedness , or danger , or sword ?
45008036	As it is written , “ For Your sake we are being put to death all day long ; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter . ”
45008037	But in all these things we are more than conquerors through Him who loved us .
45008038	For I am convinced that neither death nor life , nor angels nor principalities , nor things present nor things to come , nor powers ,
45008039	nor height nor depth , nor any other created thing will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Messiah Yeshua our Lord .
45009001	I tell the truth in Messiah — I do not lie , my conscience assuring me in the Ruach ha-Kodesh —
45009002	that my sorrow is great and the anguish in my heart unending .
45009003	For I would pray that I myself were cursed , banished from Messiah for the sake of my people — my own flesh and blood ,
45009004	who are Israelites . To them belong the adoption and the glory and the covenants and the giving of the Torah and the Temple service and the promises .
45009005	To them belong the patriarchs — and from them , according to the flesh , the Messiah , who is over all , God , blessed forever . Amen .
45009006	But it is not as though the word of God has failed . For not all those who are descended from Israel are Israel ,
45009007	nor are they all children because they are Abraham’s seed ; rather , “ Your seed shall be called through Isaac . ”
45009008	That is , it is not the children of the flesh who are children of God ; rather , the children of the promise are counted as seed .
45009009	For the word of promise is this : “ At this time I will come , and Sarah shall have a son . ”
45009010	And not only this , but also Rebecca having twins , from one act with our father Isaac .
45009011	Yet before the sons were even born and had not done anything good or bad — so that God’s purpose and choice might stand not because of works but because of Him who calls —
45009012	it was said to her , “ The older shall serve the younger . ”
45009013	As it is written , “ Jacob I loved , but Esau I hated . ”
45009014	What shall we say then ? There is no injustice with God , is there ? May it never be !
45009015	For to Moses He says , “ I will have mercy on whom I have mercy , and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion . ”
45009016	So then it does not depend on the one who wills or the one who strives , but on God who shows mercy .
45009017	For the Scripture says to Pharaoh , “ For this very purpose I raised you up — to demonstrate My power in you , so My name might be proclaimed in all the earth . ”
45009018	So then He has mercy on whom He wills , and He hardens whom He wills .
45009019	You will say to me then , “ Why does He still find fault ? For who has resisted His will ? ”
45009020	But who in the world are you , O man , who talks back to God ? Will what is formed say to the one who formed it , “ Why did you make me like this ? ”
45009021	Does the potter have no right over the clay , to make from the same lump one vessel for honor and another for common use ?
45009022	Now what if God , willing to demonstrate His wrath and to make His power known , endured with much patience vessels of wrath designed for destruction ?
45009023	And what if He did so to make known the riches of His glory on vessels of mercy , which He prepared beforehand for glory ?
45009024	Even us He called — not only from the Jewish people , but also from the Gentiles —
45009025	as He says also in Hosea , “ I will call those who were not My people , ‘ My people , ’ and her who was not loved , ‘ Beloved . ’
45009026	And it shall be that in the place where it was said to them , ‘ You are not My people , ’ there they shall be called sons of the living God . ”
45009027	Isaiah cries out concerning Israel , “ Though the number of B’nei-Israel be as the sand of the sea , only the remnant shall be saved .
45009028	For Adonai will carry out His word upon the earth , bringing it to an end and finishing quickly . ”
45009029	And just as Isaiah foretold , “ Unless Adonai-Tzva’ot had left us seed , we would have become like Sodom and resembled Gomorrah . ”
45009030	What shall we say then ? That Gentiles , who did not pursue righteousness , attained righteousness — that is , a righteousness of faith .
45009031	But Israel , who pursued a Torah of righteousness , did not reach the Torah .
45009032	Why ? Because they pursued it not by faith , but as if it were from works . They stumbled over the stone of stumbling ,
45009033	just as it is written , “ Behold , I lay in Zion a stone of stumbling and a rock of offense , and whoever believes in Him shall not be put to shame . ”
45010001	Brethren , my heart’s desire and my prayer to God for Israel is for their salvation .
45010002	For I testify about them that they have zeal for God — but not based on knowledge .
45010003	For being ignorant of God's righteousness and seeking to establish their own , they did not submit themselves to the righteousness of God .
45010004	For Messiah is the goal of the Torah as a means to righteousness for everyone who keeps trusting .
45010005	For Moses writes about the righteousness that is based on Torah , “ The man who does these things shall live by them . ”
45010006	But the righteousness based on faith speaks in this way : “ Do not say in your heart , ‘ Who will go up into heaven ? ’ ( that is , to bring Messiah down ) ,
45010007	or , ‘ Who will go down into the abyss ? ’ ( that is , to bring Messiah up from the dead ) . ”
45010008	But what does it say ? “ The word is near you , in your mouth and in your heart ” — that is , the word of faith that we are proclaiming .
45010009	For if you confess with your mouth that Yeshua is Lord , and believe in your heart that God raised Him from the dead , you will be saved .
45010010	For with the heart it is believed for righteousness , and with the mouth it is confessed for salvation .
45010011	For the Scripture says , “ Whoever trusts in Him will not be put to shame . ”
45010012	For there is no distinction between Jew and Greek , for the same Lord is Lord of all — richly generous to all who call on Him .
45010013	For “ Everyone who calls upon the name of Adonai shall be saved . ”
45010014	How then shall they call on the One in whom they have not trusted ? And how shall they trust in the One they have not heard of ? And how shall they hear without someone proclaiming ?
45010015	And how shall they proclaim unless they are sent ? As it is written , “ How beautiful are the feet of those who proclaim good news of good things ! ”
45010016	But not all heeded the Good News . For Isaiah says , “ Adonai , who has believed our report ? ”
45010017	So faith comes from hearing , and hearing by the word of Messiah .
45010018	But I say , have they never heard ? Indeed they have , for “ Their voice has gone out into all the earth , and their words to the ends of the world . ”
45010019	But I say , did Israel not understand ? First Moses says , “ I will provoke you to jealousy by those who are not a nation , with a nation empty of understanding I will vex you . ”
45010020	And Isaiah is so bold as to say , “ I was found by those who did not seek Me ; I became visible to those who did not ask for Me . ”
45010021	But about Israel He says , “ All day long I stretched forth my hands to a disobedient and contrary people . ”
45011001	I say then , God has not rejected His people , has He ? May it never be ! For I too am an Israelite , of the seed of Abraham , of the tribe of Benjamin .
45011002	God has not rejected His people whom He knew beforehand . Or do you not know what the Scripture says about Elijah , how he pleads with God against Israel ?
45011003	“ Adonai , they have killed your prophets , they have destroyed your altars ; I alone am left , and they are seeking my life . ”
45011004	But what is the divine response to him ? “ I have kept for Myself seven thousand men who have not bowed the knee to Baal . ”
45011005	So in the same way also at this present time there has come to be a remnant according to God’s gracious choice .
45011006	But if it is by grace , it is no longer by works ; otherwise grace would no longer be grace .
45011007	What then ? What Israel is seeking , it has not obtained ; but the elect obtained it , and the rest were hardened —
45011008	just as it is written , “ God gave them a spirit of stupor , eyes not to see and ears not to hear , until this very day . ”
45011009	And David says , “ Let their table become a snare and a trap , a stumbling block and a retribution for them .
45011010	Let their eyes be darkened so they do not see , and bend their back continually . ”
45011011	I say then , they did not stumble so as to fall , did they ? May it never be ! But by their false step salvation has come to the Gentiles , to provoke Israel to jealousy .
45011012	Now if their transgression leads to riches for the world , and their loss riches for the Gentiles , then how much more their fullness !
45011013	But I am speaking to you who are Gentiles . Insofar as I am a shaliach to the Gentiles , I spotlight my ministry
45011014	if somehow I might provoke to jealousy my own flesh and blood and save some of them .
45011015	For if their rejection leads to the reconciliation of the world , what will their acceptance be but life from the dead ?
45011016	If the firstfruit is holy , so is the whole batch of dough ; and if the root is holy , so are the branches .
45011017	But if some of the branches were broken off and you — being a wild olive — were grafted in among them and became a partaker of the root of the olive tree with its richness ,
45011018	do not boast against the branches . But if you do boast , it is not you who support the root but the root supports you .
45011019	You will say then , “ Branches were broken off so that I might be grafted in . ”
45011020	True enough . They were broken off because of unbelief , and you stand by faith . Do not be arrogant , but fear —
45011021	for if God did not spare the natural branches , neither will He spare you .
45011022	Notice then the kindness and severity of God : severity toward those who fell ; but God's kindness toward you , if you continue in His kindness ; otherwise you too will be cut off !
45011023	And they also , if they do not continue in their unbelief , will be grafted in ; for God is able to graft them in again .
45011024	For if you were cut out of that which by nature is a wild olive tree , and grafted contrary to nature into a cultivated olive tree , how much more will these natural branches be grafted into their own olive tree ?
45011025	For I do not want you , brethren , to be ignorant of this mystery — lest you be wise in your own eyes — that a partial hardening has come upon Israel until the fullness of the Gentiles has come in ;
45011026	and in this way all Israel will be saved , as it is written , “ The Deliverer shall come out of Zion . He shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob .
45011027	And this is My covenant with them , when I take away their sins . ”
45011028	Concerning the Good News , they are hostile for your sake ; but concerning chosenness , they are loved on account of the fathers —
45011029	for the gifts and the calling of God are irrevocable .
45011030	For just as you once were disobedient to God but now have been shown mercy because of their disobedience ,
45011031	in like manner these also have now been disobedient with the result that , because of the mercy shown to you , they also may receive mercy .
45011032	For God has shut up all in disobedience , so that He might show mercy to all .
45011033	O the depth of the riches , both of the wisdom and knowledge of God ! How unsearchable are His judgments and how incomprehensible His ways !
45011034	For “ who has known the mind of Adonai , or who has been His counselor ? ”
45011035	Or “ who has first given to Him , that it shall be repaid to him ? ”
45011036	For from Him and through Him and to Him are all things . To Him be the glory forever ! Amen .
45012001	I urge you therefore , brethren , by the mercies of God , to present your bodies as a living sacrifice — holy , acceptable to God — which is your spiritual service .
45012002	Do not be conformed to this world but be transformed by the renewing of your mind , so that you may discern what is the will of God — what is good and acceptable and perfect .
45012003	For through the grace given me , I say to everyone among you not to think more highly of yourself than you ought to think — but to use sound judgment , as God has assigned to each person a measure of faith .
45012004	For just as we have many parts in one body — and all the parts do not have the same function —
45012005	so we , who are many , are one body in Messiah and everyone parts of one another .
45012006	We have gifts that differ according to the grace that was given to us — if prophecy , in proportion to our faith ;
45012007	if service , in our serving ; or the one who teaches , in his teaching ;
45012008	or the one who exhorts , in his exhortation ; the one who gives , in generosity ; the one who leads , with diligence ; the one who shows mercy , with cheerfulness .
45012009	Let love be without hypocrisy — detesting what is evil , holding fast to the good .
45012010	Be tenderly devoted to one another in brotherly love ; outdo one another in giving honor .
45012011	Do not be lagging in zeal ; be fervent in spirit . Keep serving the Lord ,
45012012	rejoicing in hope , enduring in distress , persisting in prayer ,
45012013	contributing to the needs of the kedoshim , extending hospitality .
45012014	Bless those who persecute you — bless and do not curse .
45012015	Rejoice with those who rejoice ; weep with those who weep .
45012016	Live in harmony with one another ; do not be proud , but associate with the lowly . Do not be wise in your own eyes .
45012017	Repay no one evil for evil ; give thought to what is good in the eyes of all people .
45012018	If possible , so far as it depends on you , live in shalom with all people .
45012019	Never take your own revenge , loved ones , but give room for God’s wrath — for it is written , “ Vengeance is Mine ; I will repay , ” says Adonai .
45012020	Rather , “ If your enemy is hungry , feed him ; if he is thirsty , give him a drink . For by doing so you will heap coals of fire upon his head . ”
45012021	Do not be overcome by evil , but overcome evil with good .
45013001	Let every person submit himself to the governing authorities . For there is no authority except from God , and those that exist are put in place by God .
45013002	So whoever opposes the authority has resisted God’s direction , and those who have resisted will bring judgment on themselves .
45013003	For leaders cause no fear for good behavior , but for bad . Now if you do not want to fear the authority , do what is good and you will get his approval —
45013004	for he is God’s servant to you for your good . But if you do evil , be afraid — for he does not carry the sword for no reason ; for he is God’s servant , an avenger who inflicts punishment on the evildoer .
45013005	Therefore it is necessary to be in submission — not only because of punishment but also because of conscience .
45013006	For this reason you also pay taxes , for the authorities are God’s servants , attending diligently to this very thing .
45013007	Pay to everyone what is due them — tribute to whom tribute is due ; tax to whom tax is due ; respect to whom respect is due ; honor to whom honor is due .
45013008	Owe no one anything except to love one another , for the one who loves another has fulfilled the Torah .
45013009	For the commandments — “ You shall not commit adultery , you shall not murder , you shall not steal , you shall not covet , ” and any other commandment — are summed up in this word : “ You shall love your neighbor as yourself . ”
45013010	Love does no harm to a neighbor ; therefore love is the fullness of the Torah .
45013011	Besides this , you know the time — that it is already the hour for you to awaken from sleep ; for now our salvation is nearer than when we first came to trust .
45013012	The night is almost gone and the day is near , so let us put off the works of darkness and put on the armor of light .
45013013	Let us walk properly as in the day — not in carousing and drunkenness , not in sexual promiscuity and sensuality , not in strife and envy .
45013014	Instead , put on the Lord Messiah Yeshua , and stop making provision for the flesh — for its cravings .
45014001	Now accept the one who is weak in faith , but not for the purpose of disputes about opinions .
45014002	One person has faith to eat anything , but the weak eats only vegetables .
45014003	Don’t let the one who eats disparage the one who does not eat , and don’t let the one who does not eat judge the one who eats , for God has accepted him .
45014004	Who are you to judge another’s servant ? Before his own master he stands or falls . Yes , he shall stand , for the Lord is able to make him stand .
45014005	One person esteems one day over another while another judges every day alike . Let each be fully convinced in his own mind .
45014006	The one who observes that day does so to the Lord . The one who eats , eats to the Lord , for he gives thanks to God ; and the one who abstains , abstains to the Lord , and he gives thanks to God .
45014007	For none of us lives for himself , and none dies for himself .
45014008	For if we live , we live for the Lord ; and if we die , we die for the Lord . So whether we live or die , we belong to the Lord .
45014009	For this reason Messiah died and lived again , so that He might be Lord of both the dead and the living .
45014010	But you , why do you judge your brother ? Or you too , why do you look down on your brother ? For we all will stand before the judgment seat of God .
